children.definition: with straight beard, Polem.Phgn. 67.

definition: εὐθυγενής, prob. f.l. for - τενής in Suid., Phot.

children.definition: straightforward, plain-spoken, Pi. P. 2.86, Dam. Isid. 23, Procop. Arc. 29.
witness who gives direct evidence, Phot.
straightforward, Democr. 181.
reduce to a rectilinear figure, ὁ κύκλος -ίζεται Phlp. in APr. 477.2.
rectilinear, ἀριθμός Iamb. in Nic. p.56P. Adv. - κῶς, στίχος εὐ. ἐκκείμενος ib. p.96 P.

definition: εὐθύγραμμος, ον, = foreg., Arist. Cael. 286b13, al.; γωνία Oenopides ap. Procl. in Euc. p.333F., cf. Euc. 1.44; τὸ εὐ. (with or without σχῆμα)

children.definition: rectilinear figure, Arist. APr. 69a31, Pr. 913b18, Thphr. HP 1.12.1.

definition: εὐθυδήμονα (leg. εὐθύδημον) · ἁπλοῦν πολίτην, E. Fr. 227.

children.definition: A. Eu. 312 (lyr., s. v. l., -δίκαιοι Herm.; cf. ὀρθοδίκαιος).

direct trial, on the merits of the case, without exceptions or technical pleas, εὐθυδικίας ἀποδέχεσθαι Is. 7.3; εἰσιέναι D. 34.4; also εὐθυδικίᾳ εἰσιέναι, εἰσελθεῖν, Id. 45.6, Is. 6.43; τὸν ἐξ εὐθυδικίας λόγον συνίστασθαι Mitteis Chr. 31 vi 13 (ii B.C.).
righteous-judging, B. 5.6, A. Ag. 761 (lyr.), AP 6.346 ( Anacr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: εὐθύδικον, τό, = εὐθυδικία, IG 5(2).357.25 ( Stymphalus, iii B.C.).
run a straight course, Ph. 1.131, 327, Act.Ap. 16.11: metaph., of persons, Agath. 2.21.
running a straight course, ἄνεμοι Plb. 34.4.5; νῆες Orph. H. 22.10.
with straight intestines, Arist. HA 507b34.
straight speaking, Adam. 1.11, Hsch. (pl.).
plain-spoken, Adam. 1.16.
accurately wrought, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 27 (nisi leg. εὐεργής).
extemporized broth, coined by Eust. 1191.14.
quick-killing, mortal, πληγή Plu. Ant. 76.
with straight hair, Arist. GA 782b34, Poll. 2.22.

definition: εὐθυκαίνα ἡ σχοῖνος, διὰ τὸ εὐθέως κτείνειν, καὶ δύναται εἶναι εὐθυκταίνα, Hsch.; cf. καίνω.

children.definition: with a straight stalk, Thphr. HP 6.4.5 ( Comp.).

definition: εὐθυκτέανον ἰθὺ πεφυκυῖαν, εἰς ὀρθόν, Hsch. (- κτέσαν cod., cf. ἰθυκτέανον, εὐκτέανος.)

children.definition: easy to get at, to procure, Anon. ap. Suid.
Polem.Phgn. 15.
Suid.
fight fairly, Hsch. s.v. Θετταλὸν σόφισμα.
fighting openly, Pi. O. 7.15.
fair fight, Plu. Sert. 10.
Simon. 137.
survey, κώμης PTeb. 12.6 (ii B. C.), etc.
linear, ‘running’, opp. στερεός, πόδες Supp.Epigr. 2.568.12 ( Didyma, ii B.C.), cf. Hero *Geom. 3.19.

children.label: II
children.definition: linear, of number, [ ἀριθμός] Theo Sm. p.95 H., cf. Iamb. in Nic. p.57 P.; ἑβδομάς Theol.Ar. 44.
to be of good cheer, E. Cyc. 530, AP 5.100, Ep.Jac. 5.13: fem. dat. pl. pres. part. εὐθυμεύσαις Theoc. 15.143; περὶ τῆς κριθῆς εὐθύμει do not be anxious about . . , PAmh. 2.133.4 (ii A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: cheer, delight, τινα A. Fr. 350.4, cf. Democr. 279:— Pass., to be cheerful, Id. 3, X. HG 7.4.36; ἐπί τινι Id. Cyr. 4.1.19; ἐν ταῖς ἀτυχίαις Arist. Rh. 1379b18; πάντα-εῖσθαι χρή Aret. CA 1.1.
one must be cheerful, X. Ap. 27.

cheerfulness, contentment, Pi. I. 1.63, Pae. 1.2, B. 16.125, X. Cyr. 4.5.7, Philem. 96.4, Men. 231, etc.: in pl., Pi. O. 2.34, X. Cyr. 1.3.12, Arist. Pr. 954a25; περὶ εὐθυμίης, title of works by Democritus and Hipparchus Pythagoreus.

children.label: II
children.definition: Εὐ. personified, Pi. Fr. 155, Memn. 4.2, LW 45 ( Erythrae).
kind, generous, ἄναξ Od. 14.63.

children.label: II
children.definition: cheerful, Democr. 174, X. Cyr. 6.4.13 ( Comp.), Pl. Lg. 792b; συμπόσια εὔ. Ion Eleg. 1.14; φέρειν γῆρας εὔ. εἰς τελευτάν Pi. O. 5.22; of horses, spirited, X. Eq. 11.12 ( Sup.); τὸ εὔ., = εὐθυμία, Plu. Suav. 2.1106c, D.C. 42.1. Adv. - μως cheerfully, Batr. 159, A. Ag. 1592: Comp. - ότερον X. Cyr. 2.2.27: Sup. - ότατα ib. 3.3.12.

definition: εὔθυνα (v. infr.), ἡ, gen. εὐθύνης, acc. εὔθυναν, nom. pl. εὔθυναι: ( εὐθύνω): —

children.definition: setting straight, correction, chastisement, Pl. Prt. 326e (pl.); calling to account, POxy. 1203.9 (i A.D.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: public examination of the conduct of officials, held on the expiration of their term of office (dist. fr. λόγος ‘rendering of accounts’, οὔτε χρήματα διαχειρίσας τῆς πόλεως δίδωμι λόγον αὐτῶν, οὔτε ἀρχὴν ἄρξας οὐδεμίαν εὐθύνας ὑπέχω αὐτῆς Lys. 24.26; λόγον διδόντων τῶν χρημάτων . . καὶ εὐθύνας διδόντων IG 1(2).91.27), used in sg. by Ar. V. 571, Lys. 10.27, al.; ἡ εὔ. βλάβη τις δικαία ἐστίν Arist. Rh. 1411b20: more freq. in pl., IG l.c., Ar. Eq. 825 (anap.), etc.; πρεσβείας εὔθυναι an account of oneʼs embassage, D. 19.82; [ τῆς στρατηγίας] ἔμʼ ἀπαιτεῖς εὐθύνας Id. 18.245; opp. εὐθύνας διδόναι Ar. Pax 1187, And. 1.90; ὑποσχεῖν Lys. 30.3; κατηγορεῖν [τινος] εἰς τὰς εὐ. Antipho 6.43; τὰς εὐ. κατηγορεῖν, ἐπὶ τὰς εὐθύνας ἐλθεῖν, D. 19.81, 2; εὔθυνάν τινι ἐμβαλέσθαι Arist. Ath. 48.4, cf. Decr.ib. 39.6; εὐθύνας or εὔθυναν ὀφλεῖν to be convicted, or accused, of malversation, And. 1.73, Lys. 10.27; κλοπῆς ἕνεκα Aeschin. 3.10; εὐθύνας ἀποφυγεῖν, διαφυγεῖν, to be acquitted thereof, Pl. Lg. 946d, 947e; τῆς εὐθύνης ἀπολύειν τινά Ar. V. 571: metaph., τὰς εὐ. τὰς τοῦ βίου the accounts rendered of your life, Alex. 262.8, cf. Ph. 2.214, al. (On the accent see Hdn.Gr. 1.257.37: the later form εὐθύνη, nom. pl. εὐθῦναι is sts. found in codd. of early writers, as Lys. 10.27, Pl. Prt. 326e, but shd. prob. be corrected.)

data.quote: οὔτε χρήματα διαχειρίσας τῆς πόλεως δίδωμι λόγον αὐτῶν, οὔτε ἀρχὴν ἄρξας οὐδεμίαν εὐθύνας ὑπέχω αὐτῆς
λόγον διδόντων τῶν χρημάτων . . καὶ εὐθύνας διδόντων
ἡ εὔ. βλάβη τις δικαία ἐστίν

definition: εὐθυνία, freq. f.l. for εὐθηνία, as Aët. 5.94: so perh. εὔθυνος in EM 197.34 for εὔθηνος.

children.definition: Simon. 93.
corrector, chastiser, judge, A. Pers. 828, Eu. 273 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: public examiner (cf. εὔθυνα), IG 1(2).188, Decr. ap. And. 1.78, Pl. Lg. 945a sq., Arist. Pol. 1322b11, Ath. 48.4, SIG 38.3 (Teos, VB.C.); official of a guild, Supp.Epigr. 2.458 ( Moesia, ii/iii A.D.), etc.
straightening, opp. κάμψις, Arist. Mete. 386a7, IA 708b24; τῆς ῥινός Gal. 18(1).481.
one must correct, τοὺς Εὐκλείδου ὅρους Iamb. in Nic. p.26P.
corrector, chastiser, ὕβριος Thgn. 40.
one who levels or straightens, θριγκῶν Man. 4.293.
Adj., εὐθυντὴρ οἴαξ the guiding rudder, A. Supp. 717.
belonging to the εὐθυντηρία (cf. sq. [εὐθυντήριος] II.1b), Milet. 7.59 ( Didyma).
making straight: directing, ruling, σκῆπτρον A. Pers. 764.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. εὐθυντηρία, ἡ, the part of a ship wherein the rudder was fixed, E. IT 1356.

children.label: b
children.definition: base, plinth, socle of a wall, IG 2(2).1668.16, BCH 26.43 (Delph.), IGRom. 4.293ai38 ( Pergam., ii B.C.); εὐ.· τὸ ἐν τῷ ἐδάφει σύμμαγμα ὑπὸ τῶν ἀρχιτεκτόνων, Hsch.
τήριον, τό, rule, norm, γνώμων καὶ εὐ. Theol.Ar. 59.
Pl. Lg. 945b, 945c; δῆμος εὐθυντὴς χθονός cj. Markl. for αὐθέντης, E. Supp. 442.
of or for the conduct of εὔθυνα (q.v.), εἶδος δικαστηρίων Arist. Pol. 1300b19; λόγος εὐ. D.H. Din. 11.
capable of being straightened, Arist. Mete. 385b27.

definition: εὐθύνω, ( εὐθύς) = the Homeric ἰθύνω (which is a freq. v.l., as in A. Pers. 773): —

children.definition: guide straight, direct, οἰωνὸν γνώμῃ στομίων ἄτερ εὐθύνων Id. Pr. 289; εὐ. ἡνίας Ar. Av. 1739 (lyr.); [ ἅρματα] Isoc. 1.32; εὐ. δόρυ steer the bark straight, E. Cyc. 15; εὐ. πλάτην Id. Hec. 39; ὁ εὐθύνων the helmsman, Ep.Jac. 3.4; εὐ. ἀγέλας lead or drive them, X. Cyr. 1.1.2; εὐ. χερσί manage, guide him, S. Aj. 542; εὐ. πόδα E. Heracl. 728, etc.
direct, govern, Κύρου δὲ παῖς . . ηὔθυνε στρατόν A. Pers. 773; πᾶσαν εὐθύνων πόλιν S. Ant. 178, cf. 1164, E. Hec. 9, Pl. Min. 320d.
make straight, straighten, opp. κάμπτειν, πτέρυγας Arist. IA 709b10:— Pass., Id. Mete. 385b32.

children.label: II
children.definition: make or put straight, εὐ. δίκας σκολιάς make crooked judgements straight, Sol. 4.37; εὐ. λαοῖς δίκας Pi. P. 4.153; εὐ. οὖρον send a straight fair wind, Id. O. 13.28; εὐ. ὄλβον Id. P. 1.46; ὥσπερ ξύλον διαστρεφόμενον . . εὐ. ἀπειλαῖς καὶ πληγαῖς Pl. Prt. 325d, cf. 326e.

data.quote: ὥσπερ ξύλον διαστρεφόμενον . . εὐ. ἀπειλαῖς καὶ πληγαῖς

children.label: III
children.definition: examine the conduct of an official, Id. Plt. 299a; εὐ. τὰς ἀρχάς Arist. Pol. 1271a6, 1274a17, al.:— Pass., c. gen., -όμενος τῆς ἐφορείας Id. Rh. 1419a31.

call to account for . . , τινα κλοπῆς Plu. Cic. 9:— Pass., τῶν ἀδικημάτων ηὐθύνθη Th. 1.95; οἱ -όμενοι the culprits, Mitteis Chr. 31 iii 10 (ii B.C.), cf. Notiz.Arch. 4.21 ( Cyrene, i B.C.): c. dat., εὐ. φόνῳ PTeb. 14.4 (ii B.C.); to be mulcted, punished, ἐπί τινι D.C. Fr. 90, al.: abs., IG 1(2).41.6; ἑκατὸν δραχμῆσι ib. 4.15, al.

refute or censure, τοὺς λόγους τινός Phld. Piet. 67; τὴν Φιλίστου διάλεκτον Plu. Nic. 1:— Pass., to be refuted, διʼ αὐτῶν τῶν φαινομένων Phld. Sign. 30, cf. Plot. 3.6.13; but also, to be critically examined, Id. 4.6.13.
examine by torture, Procop. Goth. 3.32 ( Pass).

children.label: IV
children.definition: serve as εὔθυνος, Pl. Lg. 946d.
vivid dream Arist. Div.Somn. 463a25, Gp. 2.35.4 (pl.).
dreaming vividly, Arist. Div.Somn. 463b16, cf. Plu. Def.orac. 2.437f.

definition: εὐθύορον τόπος ἐπʼ εὐθείας ἔχων τὸν ὅρον, EM 391.48, Phot.

children.definition: sail straight, ἐπί τι Str. 11.2.3, cf. Arr. Cyn. 25.8: metaph., Cerc. 5.16.
straight voyage, in dat. -πλοίᾳ Str. 3.3.1, prob. l. in Id. 6.3.7.
straight weaving, evenness of texture, Pl. Plt. 283a, 311b.
sailing straight, Str. 6.3.7 (dub. l.).
straight-blowing, Pi. N. 7.29; ἄνεμοι Arist. Mu. 394b35.

children.label: II
children.definition: breathing freely, Hp. Epid. 6.2.19.
guiding straight, αἰών Pi. N. 2.7.

go straight forward, πότμος εὐθυπορῶν (metaph. from a ship) unswerving destiny, A. Ag. 1005 (lyr.); of motion, Arist. IA 710a7; opp. ἀνακάμπτειν, of ἀποδείξεις, Id. de An. 407a29: c. acc. cogn., εὐ. ὁδόν, δρόμον, hold a straight course, Pi. O. 7.91, I. 5(4).60.

children.label: II
children.definition: have a straight grain, of trees, Thphr. CP 1.8.4.
straightness of course, Pl. Lg. 747a, Arist. Aud. 802a30.

children.label: II
children.definition: straightness of grain in wood, Thphr. HP 5.6.2.
moving in a straight line: - κά, τά, Phlp. in Mete. 12.33.
going straight, of colour, Democr. ap. Thphr. Sens. 73; τάσις, opp. μεταληπτική, Gal. 10.443: metaph., straightforward, ἦθος Pl. Lg. 775d.

children.label: II
children.definition: with a straight passage, κέρας Arist. Aud. 802b11; with straight grain, of wood, Thphr. CP 5.17.3 ( Sup.).
PLips. 2.6 (i A.D.), 5ii7 (iii A.D.), in gen. sg. - ρίνου.
speak in a straightforward manner, ‘call a spade a spade’, ὁ σοφὸς -ήσει Zeno Stoic. 1.22; utter off-hand, Plu. Demetr. 14.
plainness of speech, Phld. Rh. 2.281 S., M.Ant. 11.6, S.E. M. 2.22.
plain-spoken, Cic. Fam. 12.16.3 ( Comp.), Poll. 5.119. Adv. -μόνως Id. 4.24.
straight-rooted, Thphr. HP 1.7.2.
straight-nosed, PAmh. 2.51.23 (i B.C.), BGU 993 ii 11 (ii B.C.), al.; nom. εὔθυ-ρρις ( v.l. - ριν) Poll. 2.73.
with beautiful shaft, νάρθηξ E. Ba. 1158 (lyr.).

definition: εὐθύς, εῖα, ύ, Ion. and Ep. ἰθύς (q.v.: so always in Hom.and Hdt.),

children.definition: straight, direct, whether vertically or horizontally, opp. σκολιός, καμπύλος, Pl. Tht. 194b, R. 602c, etc.; κατὰ τὸ εὐθὺ ἑστάναι stands still with reference to the vertical, of a spinning top, ib. 436e; εὐ. πλόος, ὁδοί, Pi. O. 6.103, N. 1.25, etc.; εὐθυτέρα ὁδός X. Cyr. 1.3.4; ὁδοὺς εὐθείας ἔτεμε Th. 2.100; ῥόμβος ἀκόντων Pi. O. 13.93; εὐθείᾳ (sc. ὁδῷ) by the straight road, Pl. Lg. 716a; εὐθεῖαν ἕρπε A. Fr. 195; τὴν εὐ. E. Med. 384; ἐπʼ εὐθείας D.S. 19.38, Ascl. Tact. 2.6, Plot. 2.1.8; so also εἰς τὸ εὐ.βλέπειν X. Eq. 7.17, etc.; πλήρης τοῦ εὐθέος tired of going straight forward, ib. 14; ἡ ἐς τὸ εὐ. τῆς ῥητορικῆς ὁδός the direct road to . . , Luc. Rh.Pr. 10; κατʼ εὐθύ on level ground, LXX 3 Ki. 21.23; but ἡ κατʼ εὐ. τάσις in the direct line, Apollon.Cit. 2; on the same side, Gal. 8.62; also, opp. εἰς τὸ ἐντός, Plot. 6.7.14.

straightforward, frank, of persons, εὐθὺν χρὴ τὸν ἑταῖρον ἔμμεν καὶ μὴ σκολιὰ φρονεῖν Scol. 16; κοινᾶνι παρʼ εὐθυτάτῳ Pi. P. 3.28; ῥῆτραι Tyrt. 4.6; τόλμα Pi. O. 13.12; δίκα Id. N. 10.12; κρῖνε δʼ εὐθεῖαν δίκην A. Eu. 433, cf. Ἀρχ.Ἐφ. 1911.134 ( Gonni); ὁ εὐθὺς λόγος E. Hipp. 492; τὸ εὐ. τε καὶ τὸ ἐλεύθερον Pl. Tht. 173a; ἀπὸ τοῦ εὐθέος λέγειν to speak straight out, Th. 3.43; ἐκ τοῦ εὐ. ὑπουργεῖν outright, openly, without reserve, Id. 1.34; ἐκ τοῦ εὐ., opp. διʼ αἰνιγμάτων, Paus. 8.8.3: in fem., τὴν εὐθεῖάν τινι συνειπεῖν Plu. Cic. 7; ἁπλῶς καὶ διʼ εὐθείας Id. Pyth. 2.408e; ἀπʼ εὐθείας Adul. 57a, Fab. 3; κατʼ εὐθεῖαν by direct reasoning, Dam. Pr. 432; μηδὲν ἐξ εὐθείας παρέχει (an amulet) does no good directly, Sor. 2.42.

data.quote: εὐθὺν χρὴ τὸν ἑταῖρον ἔμμεν καὶ μὴ σκολιὰ φρονεῖν
τὸ εὐ. τε καὶ τὸ ἐλεύθερον

children.definition: εὐθεῖα, ἡ, as Subst.,

children.label: a
children.definition: γραμμή) straight line, Arist. APr. 49b35, al., Euc. 1 Def. 7, al.; ἐπʼ εὐθείας εἶναι lie in a straight line, Archim. Con.Sph. 7, al.; ἐπὶ τὴν αὐτὴν εὐ., ἐπὶ τῆς αὐτῆς εὐ. ἐκτείνειν, in the same line, Plb. 3.113.2, 3; ἐπὶ μίαν εὐ. ib. 8: Comp., εὐθυτέρα ἡ γραμμὴ γίνεται Arist. Mech. 855a24.

children.label: b
children.definition: πτῶσις) nominative case, D.T. 636.5, A.D. Pron. 6.11, etc.; κατʼ εὐθύ in the nominative, Arist. SE 182a3.

children.label: B
children.definition: Adv., εὐθύς and εὐθύ, the former prop. of Time, the latter of Place, Phryn. 119, etc.

children.label: I
children.definition: εὐθύ, of Place, straight, usu. of motion or direction, εὐθὺ Πύλονδε straight to . . , h.Merc. 342; εὐθὺ πρὸς τὰ νυμφικὰ λέχη S. OT 1242; εὐ. [τὴν ἐπὶ] Βαβυλῶνος straight towards . . , X. Cyr. 5.2.37: and so c. gen., εὐ. τῶν κυρηβίων, εὐθὺ Πελλήνης, Ar. Eq. 254, Av. 1421; εὐ.τοῦ Διός Id. Pax 68; εὐ. τοὐρόφου Eup. 47; εὐ. τῆς σωτηρίας Ar. Pax 301, cf. Th. 8.88, etc.; ἀποθανούμενος ᾔει εὐ. τοῦ δαιμονίου in opposition to . . , Pl. Thg. 129a (s.v.l.); cf. ἰθύς.

children.label: b
children.definition: νῆσον οἰκεῖ εὐθὺ Ἴστρου opposite . . , Max.Tyr. 15.7.
simply, καλεῖν Thphr. HP 3.8.2, cf. 9.13.2.
Philoch. 144, Arist. Rh. 1414b25, UPZ 77.27 (ii B.C.), PGrenf. 1.1.24 (ii B.C.), Aristeas 24, Luc. Nav. 22.

children.label: II
children.definition: εὐθύς,

straightway, forthwith, Pi. O. 8.41; ὁ δʼ εὐ. ὡς ἤκουσε A. Pers. 361; ὁ δʼ εὐ. ἐξῴμωξεν S. Aj. 317; τὸ μὲν εὐ. τὸ δὲ καὶ διανοούμενον Th. 1.1, cf. 5.3, 7.77; joined with other adverbial words, τάχα δʼ εὐ. ἰών Pi. P. 4.83; εὐ. κατὰ τάχος Th. 6.101; εὐ. παραχρῆμα (v. sub παραχρῆμα) ; εὐ. ἀπʼ αρχῆς Ar. Pax 84 (anap.); εὐ. ἐξ ἀρχῆς X. Cyr. 7.2.16; ἐξ ἀρχῆς εὐ. Arist. Pol. 1287b10; εὐ. κατʼ ἀρχάς Pl. Ti. 24b; ἀφʼ ἑσπέρας εὐ. ἤδη Luc. Gall. 1; εὐ. ἐκ νέου, ἐκ παιδός, even from oneʼs youth, Pl. R. 485d, 519a; εὐ. ἐκ παιδίου X. Cyr. 1.6.20: with a part., εὐ. νέοι ὄντες Th. 2.39; εὐ. ἥκων X. An. 4.7.2; εὐ. ἀπεκτονώς D. 23.127; τοῦ θέρους εὐ. ἀρχομένου just at the beginning of summer, Th. 2.47; ἀρξάμενος εὐ. καθισταμένου [τοῦ πολέμου] from the very beginning of the war, Id. 1.1; εὐ. ἀποβεβηκότι immediately on disembarking, Id. 4.43; εὐ. γενομένοις at the moment of birth, Pl. Tht. 186b: metaph., at once, naturally, ὑπάρχει εὐθὺς γένη ἔχον τὸ ὄν Being falls at once into genera, Arist. Metaph. 1004a5, cf. Po. 1452a14: with Subst., ἡ τῶν Ἰταλιωτῶν εὐθὺς φυγή Hdn. 8.1.5.

data.quote: τὸ μὲν εὐ. τὸ δὲ καὶ διανοούμενον

children.definition: ὑπὲρ τῆς πόλεως εὐ. just above the city, Th. 6.96; παρʼ αὐτὴν εὐ. ὁ ἔσπλους ἐστίν directly past it (the mole), Id. 8.90; ἐγγύτατα τούτου εὐ. ἐχομένη immediately adjoining this, ibid., cf. Theoc. 25.23; εὐ. ἐπὶ τὴν γέφυραν Foed. ap. Th. 4.118, cf. X. Cyr. 7.2.1, 2, 2.4.24, Ages. 1.29; τὴν εὐ. Ἄργους κἀπιδαυρίας ὁδόν the road leading straight to Argos, E. Hipp. 1197 (condemned by Phot.); εὐ. Λυκείου Pherecr. 110, cf. Arist. HA 498a32, etc.
directly, simply, v.l. in Pl. Men. 100a.
for instance, to take the first example that occurs, ὥσπερ ζῷον εὐθύς Arist. Pol. 1277a6, cf. Cael. 284b10, etc.; οἷον εὐθύς Cleom. 1.1, D.Chr. 11.145.

children.label: C
children.definition: Adv. εὐθέως, used just as εὐθύς, S. Aj. 31, OC 994, E. Fr. 31, Pl. Phd. 63a, etc.; αἰσθόμενος εὐθέως as soon as he perceived, Lys. 3.11; ἐπεὶ εὐθέως ᾔσθοντο X. HG 3.2.4; εὐθέως παραχρῆμα Antipho 1.20, D. 52.6.
οἷον εὐθέως as for example, Plb. 6.52.1, 12.5.6 (dub. sens. in Hp. Art. 55); so εὐ. alone, Ph. 2.589. ( εὐθέως is the commoner form in later Greek, PCair.Zen. 34.17 (iii B.C.), etc.)
well-fringed, ζώνη AP 6.202 ( Leon.).
auspicious sacrifice, Phld. Oec. p.33 J. (pl.).
slightly curved, Orib. 45.18.33.
look straight at, Plu. QConv. 2.737a.
seeing straight, Hsch. s.v. οὐκ εὐθυσκόπου.
straightness, trans. of Hebr. Shur, Ph. 1.576.
talking plainly, EM 191.33, Sch. Luc. JTr. 27; f.l. for εὔστομος, Poll. 5.60.
straight, ὁδός Ph. 1.456, cf. Dion.Byz. 3; πλοῦς Iamb. VP 3.16; εὐ. τὴν τρίχα Ael. NA 4.34: Medic., τομή Antyll. ap. Orib. 44.8.1. Adv. - νῶς ib. 9, Ph. 1.338, Gal. 18(1).797.
straightness, opp. καμπυλότης, Arist. Cat. 10a12; opp. περιφέρεια, Id. Mete. 385b30; εὐ. τριχῶν, opp. οὐλότης, Id. GA 782a3; ἡ εὐ. τῆς τάσεως the direction . . , Gal. 6.193.

children.label: II
children.definition: righteousness, LXX Jo. 24.14, al.
simple interest, IG 12(5).860.25 ( Tenos), 5(1).1146.37 ( Gythium).
make a straight incision, Antyll. ap. Orib. 44.8.23:—hence εὐθῠ-τομία, ἡ, ib. 4, al.
cut straight, straight, ὁδός Pi. P. 5.90.
παλίντονος, term applied to the lighter torsion-engines, τὰ εὐ. ὄργανα Hero Bel. 74.5, 104.4; καταπάλται Ath.Mech. 14.6.
with a straight neck, of the bladder, Sor. 1.18.
running in a straight line, IG 2(2).463.73.
bored straight through, [ ὀστᾶ] Gal. UP 8.7, cf. Ruf. ap. Orib. 8.24.62, Antyll.ib. 8.13.1.
Arist. HA 629b35, Polem.Phgn. 57.
Democr. ap. Thphr. Sens. 73.
running in a straight line, Pl. Lg. 815b.
straight-barked, name of a kind of oak, Thphr. HP 3.8.2.
to move in a straight line, Procl. in Prm. p.906 S.
motion in a straight line, Arist. Ph. 227b18.
whole-hearted, sincere, A. Eu. 1040, f.l. ib. 1034 (both lyr.).
straight-grown, opp. παρεστραμμένος, cj. Scalig. in Thphr. HP 4.2.6.
payable on demand in cash (copper), POxy. 1482.15 (ii A.D.).

definition: εὐθυῶνυξ, υχος, ὁ, ἡ, or εὐθῠ-ώνῠχος, ον,

children.definition: with straight nails or talons, Arist. HA 517a33, 600a19, 633b2.
go straight forward, v.l. for εὐθυπορέω, Arist. Pr. 905b6.

straight course or direction, Pl. R. 436e, Ti. 45c, Arist. de An. 406b31; κατʼ εὐθυωρίαν longitudinally, Id. PA 654a17; also ἀντικροῦσαι κατʼ εὐ. to oppose directly, Id. Rh. 1379a11; κατʼ εὐ. νοῆσθαι, opp. κατʼ ἀναλογίαν, Ti.Locr. 94b; ἄπειρα εἰς εὐ. in an infinite series, Arist. Metaph. 994a2; εὐθυωρίᾳ ἐπὶ θάλασσαν SIG 685.65 ( Itanos, ii B.C.), cf. ib. 421.48 ( Thermon, iii B.C.); ἀν εὐθυωρείαν (sic) Tab.Heracl. 1.65; also Arc. εὐθυορϝίαν BCH 39.55 (Orchom. Arc., iv B.C.); cf. ἰθυωρίη.

in a straight direction: mostly in neut. εὐθύωρον as Adv., = εὐθύς, εὐ. ἄγειν X. An. 2.2.16, Ael. NA 11.16; ὁρᾶν ib. 7.5: as Adj., εὐθύωρον τὴν ἀναχώρησιν ἐποιήσαντο Anon. ap. EM 391.42, cf. Procop. Aed. 2.2.
well-mailed, AP 9.389 ( Trajan), Nonn. D. 15.156; μύες Marc.Sid. 30.
S. Ichn. 221, E. Cyc. 495 (lyr.).
Bacchic, θίασοι APl. 16.289:—fem. εὐιάς, άδος, AP 9.603 ( Antip.); οἴνη IG 3.779.
easy to heal or remedy, Arist. EN 1121a20, Thphr. HP 5.4.5, Porph. Abst. 1.56, freq. in Comp., Hp. Art. 14, X. Eq. 4.2, etc.
easily perspiring, Thphr. Sud. 20: but neut. εὔιδρον, ib. 19:—also εὐίδρωτος, ον, Gal. 6.222: pl. εὐίδρωτα Arist. Pr. 867b35.
sanctity, sacredness, Sammelb. 1007 (i A.D.).

fit for sacrifice, πέλανοι Pae.Oxy. 675.14; θύματα IG 5(1).1390.70 ( Andania, i B.C.); θυηπολίαι AP 6.231 ( Phil.): generally, holy, θυμέλαι Ath.Mitt. 17.272 (iii A.D.); βοαί Orac. in Milet. 7.64 (ii/iii A.D.).
open to entreaty, gloss on εὐάντητος, EM 388.40.

definition: εὐιλασία εὐπειστία, prob. in Hsch., cf. Gloss.
εὐιλάσιμος, ον, = sq., prob. l. in Sammelb. 4116.5.

children.definition: very merciful, of deities, PCair.Zen. 34.19 (iii B.C.), IG 3.73, GDI 3543 ( Cnidus), etc.; εὐ. ἐγένου αὐτοῖς LXX Ps. 98(99).8; also τυχεῖν εὐιλάτου τοῦ βασιλέος PPetr. 2p.45 (iii B.C.); later written εὐειλ- GDI 3536 ( Cnidus), UPZ 109.6 (i B.C.):—hence εὐιλᾰτ-εύω, to be merciful, LXX De. 29.20(19), al.
with stout fibres, ξύλον Thphr. HP 3.10.1, Ign. 72.

definition: Εὔιος( Εὔἱος EM 391.15, cf. Lat. Euhius), ὁ,

children.definition: εὐαἵ, εὐοἱ, in lyr. passages, S. OT 211, E. Ba. 157, Ecphantid. 3, etc.; Εὔιος, = Βάκχος, E. Ba. 566, 579.

children.label: II
children.definition: εὔιος, ον, as Adj., Bacchic, πῦρ S. Ant. 964; τελεταί E. Ba. 238; ἀγάλματα Id. Tr. 451 (troch.).

definition: εὔιππος, Ep. ἐΰιππος, ον, of persons,

children.definition: delighting in horses, h.Ap. 210, Hes. Cat.Oxy. 1358.21, Pi. O. 3.39: Sup., X. HG 4.2.5, etc.
famed for horses, Pi. P. 4.2, S. OC 668 (lyr.).
of knowledge, Epigr. ap. Plu. Lib.educ. 2.14c (leg. εὐκταῖον).
with beautiful hips, γυνή Inscr.Prien. 317, cf. AP 5.115 ( Marc. Arg.); of a horse, with fine quarters, Hippiatr. 115; βόες Hsch. s.v. κάμινοι.
abounding in fish, θάλασσα D.S. 11.57, cf. Ath. 8.360e, Aristid. Or. 44(17).16, Philostr. VA 3.55.
Bacchic, χοροί Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 22:—fem. εὐῐῶτις, ιδος, οἴνη MoschioTrag. 6.11.
easily burnt, Dsc. 4.150, Sch. A.R. 1.434 ( Sup.).
easy to conquer, Th. 7.18 ( Comp.); easily exhausted, δυνάμεις Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 5.30.11; unstable, τύχη, πρᾶγμα, Vett.Val. 175.30, 212.21.
Hsch., Sch. Od. 2.390, etc.; on ἐύζυγος, Sch. A.R. 1.4.
easy to keep under or restrain, X. Cyr. 7.5.69 ( Sup.).
consecrated, IG 14.455 ( Catana, v A.D.).

have opportunity, leisure or time, PSI 4.342.2 (iii B.C.), Plb. 20.9.4, 1 Ep.Cor. 16.12, etc.: c. inf., οὐδὲ φαγεῖν ηὐκαίρουν Ev.Marc. 6.31, cf. Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.223d, Luc. Am. 33; τοῦ διαβῆναι PEleph. 29.7 (iii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: τινι or εἴς τι, devote oneʼs leisure to a thing, εὐ. τοῖς ἀθανάτοις ἑαυτοῦ Chio Ep. 16.6; εὐ. εἰς οὐδὲν ἕτερον ἢ . . Act.Ap. 17.21.

children.label: III
children.definition: enjoy good times, prosper, Plb. 4.60.10; τοῖς βίοις Id. 32.5.12: in this sense also εὐκαιρέομαι, Posidon. 59 J.
to be timely, Phld. Rh. 2.64 S., Epicur. (?) Oxy. 215ii2.
favourable opportunity, dub. in POxy. 123.3 (iii/iv A.D.).
seasonable, opportune act, Stoic. 3.136 (pl.).

good season, opportunity, τὴν εὐ. διαφυλάττειν Isoc. 12.34; ἀπολαύειν τῆς εὐ. Phld. D. 3 Fr. 89; εὐκαιρίαν ζητεῖν ἵνα . . Ev.Matt. 26.16; εὐ. τοῦ ἐλθεῖν PMich. in Class.Phil. 22.250 (ii A.D.); leisure, Hp. Ep. 17, 23; κατὰ πολλὴν εὐ. καὶ σχολήν D.H. Comp. 23—a usage condemned by Phot. and Suid. s.v. σχολή.

children.label: II
children.definition: appropriateness, opp. ἀκαιρία, Pl. Phdr. 272a; μεταφορᾶς, στίχων, Plu. Aud.poet. 2.16b, QConv. 736f.
convenient situation, τῶν πόλεων Plb. 16.29.3, cf. 4.44.11, Ph. 1.4.
opportune supply, ὑδάτων, of rainfall or irrigation, Thphr. CP 3.23.4 (pl.), D.S. 1.52.

children.label: III
children.definition: wealth, prosperity, αἱ τῶν βίων εὐ. Plb. 1.59.7, cf. 13.9.2 (cj.), etc.; εὐ. οὐκ ἔχει he has no property, BGU 665ii4 (i A.D.).

well-timed, seasonable, λόγος Philem. 113; θάνατος Com.Adesp. 116; ὕδατα (rainfall) Thphr. HP 8.7.6; nihil -ότερον epistula tua, Cic. Att. 4.7.1: c. inf., χὥ τι σοι λέγειν εὔκαιρόν ἐστι S. OC 32, cf. Epicur. Nat. 28.4; -ότερον ἔσται διελθεῖν J. AJ 12.9.7; τὸ εὔκαιρον, = εὐκαιρία, D.H. Din. 7; τὸ μέτριον καὶ τὸ εὔ. ἐν ἡδοναῖς Aristo Stoic. 1.86; εὔκαιρον ἀείσας in season, Pl. Epigr. 22.5 Diehl.

data.quote: χὥ τι σοι λέγειν εὔκαιρόν ἐστι
τὸ μέτριον καὶ τὸ εὔ. ἐν ἡδοναῖς

children.label: II
children.definition: convenient, well situated, τόποι PPetr. 2p.28 ( iii B.C., Sup.), cf. Plb. 4.38.1 ( Sup.), D.S. 1.63, etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: rich, wealthy, dub.l. in St. Byz. s.v. Χαττηνία.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Adv. - ρως seasonably, opportunely, Hp. Medic. 3, Nico 1, PCair.Zen. 38.28 (iii B.C.), al., etc.; εὐ. χρῆσθαί τινι Isoc. 5.143; εὐ. ἔχειν πρός τι Id. 11.12, Arist. HA 582a28; favourably, propitiously, PCair.Zen. 46 (iii B.C.), POxy. 2086r. 6 ( ii A.D., εὐκερως Pap.): Comp. - ότερον Pl. Phd. 78a: Sup. - ότατα Plb. 5.63.13.
οὐκ-ρως ἔχειν to have no leisure, Id. 5.26.10.
easily affected by disease, Aët. 12.19; to be read for εὐπαθής in Gal. 19.208.
beautifully adorned, Hsch. s.v. κοσμιωτάτη, Phot. s.v. κεκομψευμένος.
of easy labour, easy, κάματος E. Ba. 66 (lyr.).
εὐ. στέφανοι crowns won by noble toils, APl. 16.335.
easily enduring fatigue, Philostr. Gym. 42.
laborious, ἄγρη Nonn. D. 5.483; caused by toil, ἱδρῶτες Id. 25.28.

definition: εὐκαμία ἡσυχία, ἤτοι εὐφημία ( Dor.), EM 392.5 (i.e. εὐκᾱλία,

children.definition: εὐκᾱμία (fr. κημός), = εὐφιμία, cf. Hsch. s.v. εὐκαλεία, εὐκληρία).
flexibility, of the body, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.35.1.

well-bent or curved, δρέπανον Od. 18.368; κληῗδʼ εὐκαμπέα 21.6; χαλάσασʼ εὐκαμπέα τόξα h.Hom. 27.12; ἄροτρον, ἅρπη, Max. 458, A.R. 3.1388; εὐκαμπὴς τὰ κέρατα Luc. DMar. 15.2; τὸ εὐ. τῶν μελῶν Id. Im. 14.

children.label: II
children.definition: flexible, φλοιός Thphr. HP 3.10.4; κλάδοι Str. 15.1.20; κατασκευάζειν τὸ κέρας εὐ. Plu. Sull. 17; of timber, Orib. 9.19.2 ( Comp.); πῦον slippery, Aret. SD 1.10. ( εὐκαμπὲς ἄγκιστρον AP 6.4 ( Leon.) is corrupt: εὐκᾰπές ( κάπτω) easily swallowed, Salm.)

definition: εὔκαμπος, ον, = sq., Hp. Art. 60 ( v.l. - πτοι).

children.definition: flexible, Sapph. Supp. 5.13, Arist. PA 692a2.
flexibility, of the voice, Arist. GA 786b10.
stout-hearted, S. Aj. 364 (lyr.), Ph. 535, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.247, etc.; of a horse, spirited, X. Eq. 6.14. Adv. - ίως with stout heart, E. Hec. 549, D.H. 5.8, J. AJ 12.9.4, BJ 7.8.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: good for the stomach, Diocl. Fr. 120 ( Comp.), Ruf. ap. Orib. 5.11.3 ( Sup.), Xenocr. 8.
good for the heart, restorative, cordial, Hp. Aff. 41, 54, Alex.Trall. Febr. 4.
είᾳ ( -ίᾳ codd.), E. Tr. 217 (lyr.); cf. παγκάρπεια.
bear good fruit or crops, Hp. Ep. 10, Thphr. CP 1.20.5, HP 2.7.7, Str. 5.2.7, BGU 1040.5 (ii A. D.).

definition: εὐκάρπησις, εως, ἡ, f.l. for ἐκκάρπησις, Gal. 6.665.

children.definition: fruitfulness, IG 1(2).76.45, Arist. Fr. 252, Thphr. CP 2.1.2; cf. εὐκάρπεια.

fruitful, of women, h.Hom. 30.5; of trees, corn, land, Pi. P. 1.30, N. 1.14, Pae. 2.26, etc.; of sheep, Palaeph. 18; φυτά, ζῷα, Ocell. 4.9; [ χώρη] -οτάτη Hp. Aër. 12; εὔ. θέρος S. Aj. 671: metaph., -οτάτη ἀρετή Ph. 1.647.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., fruitful, fertilizing, ἀήρ Thphr. CP 2.3.3; epith. of Aphrodite, S. Fr. 847; of Dionysus, AP 6.31; of Demeter, ib. 7.394 ( Phil.).
easily overthrown, Eust. 1055.51.
exposed to ridicule, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.80.
blameworthy, Mitteis Chr. 31 viii 11 (ii B. C.), EM 400.6.
easy to wind up, of a torsion-engine (cf. καταγωγίς), Ph. Bel. 53.33.
good for landing in, λιμήν Eust. ad D.P. 195.
easily conquered, Plb. 9.4.8, Luc. Tyr. 22.
easily burnt, gloss on εὐκατάπρηστος, Suid., Phot.
easy to be transported, ὕλη Str. 12.3.12.
easy to hold or defend, Plb. 4.56.9.
easily broken, fragile, τὸ εὐ. Ph. 2.309, Artem. 1.66 (- έακτον codd.).
with a good termination, Eust. 1613.33.
easy to apprehend or recognize, Erot. Praef., Heliod. ap. Orib. 46.28.3, Artem. 1.1a, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. - τως, ἔχειν to be easily bandaged by κατάληψις (q.v.), Hp. Off. 9.

children.label: III
children.definition: easy to capture, of cities, Hsch. s.v. διατειχίζειν.
easily appeased, placable, opp. μνησίκακος, Arist. Rh. 1381b5, cf. Vit.Philonid. p.3C., LXX 3 Ma. 5.13. Adv. - τως, ἔχειν πρός τινας Sch. S. Aj. 1345.
easy to overthrow, X. HG 3.5.15 ( Comp.).
easy to understand, Hp. Acut. 28, Gal. 7.463.
easily conquered, Sch. Th. 6.17.
affabilis, Gloss.
easy to observe or understand, Plb. 18.30.11, Ptol. Tetr. 30.
easy to throw in wrestling, EM 400.5.
easily pacified, Gal. 1.334, Paul.Aeg. 1.66.
easily scared, Lib. Arg.D.Prooem. 11.
easily swallowed, Philum. ap. Aët. 9.19.
easily accomplished, Poll. 9.161.
placable, Gloss.
easily kindled or set on fire, ὕλη Ph. Fr. 103 H., Suid.
easily counted, Gal. 7.463.
easily shaken or thrown down, Eust. 969.61.
convenient for inspection, Hp. Fract. 30, Gal. 2.700.
easily constructed, Ph. Bel. 60.51: Comp., ib. 61.6.
well-made, ἅρμα Sch. E. Hipp. 1226.
well-fixed, firmly established, διάθεσις Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.87, cf. Asp. in EN 106.11; τὰ τοῦ τόνου εὐ. γίνεται A.D. Adv. 157.16.
brought to a good conclusion, well-turned, of a period: only in Adv. - φως, ἀπηρτίσθαι Demetr. Eloc. 10.
easily held fast, Hp. Fract. 22 ( Comp.).
easy to set in order, Ptol. Geog. 1.1.
easily overrun or attacked, Str. 14.5.6; of writers, open to attack, incorrect, Id. 1.2.2:—also εὐκατά-τροχος, Hsch.
Hsch. s.v. ὑγρός.
corruptibilis, Gloss.
propensity, proclivity, Stoic. 3.25 (pl.).
prone towards, πρός τι Arist. EN 1109a15, Plu. Garr. 2.503c.

easy to be despised, contemptible, ὑπό τινος X. HG 6.4.1, cf. Cyr. 8.3.1, D. 4.18, Men. Sam. 297, Arist. Pol. 1312b24, etc.; negligible, πᾶσα ἀλγηδὼν εὐ. Epicur. Sent.Vat. 4, cf. Phld. D. 1.25, al.; esp. in Lit. Crit., D.H. Comp. 3, Longin. 3.1, Demetr. Eloc. 4, etc. Adv. - τως Plu. Demetr. 16.
well considered, dub. l. in Ph. 1.664.
safe to tell lies about, Str. 1.2.19.
easy to work, χώρα Thphr. CP 4.7.3 ( Comp.); ἔρια Gal. 18(2).525; of food, easy of digestion, X. Mem. 4.3.6 ( Comp.), Diph.Siph. ap. Ath. 2.91e, Dsc. 2.90, Sor. 1.49.
easy of accomplishment, D. Ep. 1.6 ( Comp.), Arist. Rh. 1363a31; εὐκατεργαστότερόν ἐστι c. inf., X. HG 6.1.12.
easy to subdue or conquer, D.H. 3.20; πᾶσιν Plu. Pyrrh. 19.
easy to blame, open to accusation, Antipho Soph. 51, Th. 6.77, Plb. 4.29.3.
convenient for dwelling in, gloss on εὔκτιτος, Sch. E. Or. 1621.
easily seen, conspicuous, χῶρος Aen.Tact. 27.2: c. dat., τοῖς ἀθανάτοις εὐ. Satyr. Vit.Eur.Fr. 39ii22.
easily effected, πολιορκία D.S. 34/ 5.2.45; χειρουργία Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.23.23. Adv. - τως Sch. A.R. 1.246.
easily burning, Thphr. Ign. 72 ( Comp.), Sch. Ar. Pax 1134 ( Sup., εὐκαστοτα cod.): εὔκαυτος, Phot. s.v. πισσοκωνήτῳ πυρί.
easily cleft or split, Eust. 1241.48.
κέδρου τʼ εὐκεάτοιο Od. 5.60; ἐρινεοῦ εὐ. Theoc. 25.248.
well-sounding, melodious, λωτός E. Ba. 160 (lyr.); χοροί Ar. Nu. 312 (lyr.); μολπά AP 7.194 ( Mnasalc.); κιθάρης γῆρυς Not.Scav. 1912.459 ( Ostia), cf. Epic. in Arch.Pap. 7.8.
pointed, βέλος AP 9.339 ( Arch.).
easily evacuated, Gal. 10.626.
easily disabled, δύναμις, to be read in Gal. 19.207.
with beautiful horns, Mosch. 2.52; Διόνυσος AP 9.827 ( Ammon.).
well-tempered constitution, PMag.Leid.W. 17.35.
well-mixed, well-tempered, ἀήρ Plu. Fac.lun. 2.922e; ἦχος D.H. Comp. 22.
gainful, Opp. C. 1.37.
to be rich in money, Eub. 144; condemned by Phryn. 339.
contr. for εὐκέραος, ἄγρα S. Aj. 64; [ τράγος] Herod. 8.17: neut. pl., τὰ εὔκερω Max.Tyr. 35.7: acc. pl. εὐκέρωτας Gp. 18.1.3:—poet. ἠΰκερος, Μήνη Doroth. ap. Heph.Astr. 3.30.
with a good head, Arr. Cyn. 4.4 (del. Hercher), Poll. 2.43, Hippiatr. 115.
she that lulls or soothes, παίδων εὐ. Hes. Op. 464.
quiet, Hsch.

definition: εὔκηλος (A), ον (cf. Hdn.Gr. 1.161), Dor. εὔκᾱλος, (v. ἕκηλος)

children.definition: free from care, at oneʼs ease, εὔκηλος τὰ φράζεαι ἅσσʼ ἐθέλῃσθα Il. 1.554; εὗδον δʼ εὔκηλοι Od. 14.479, cf. S. El. 241 (lyr.); ἡμεῖς μὲν . . πολέας τελέοντες ἀέθλους . . , ὁ δʼ εὔκηλος . . Od. 3.263; εὔκηλοι πολέμιζον Il. 17.371; εὔκηλος τότε νῆα θοὴν . . ἑλκέμεν ἐς πόντον, i.e. without fear, Hes. Op. 671, cf. h.Merc. 480; εὔ. τέρπου φρένα Pherecr. 152.
Ep. of things, νὺξ εὔ. still, silent, Theoc. 2.166; πτέρυγες εὔ. steady, even, A.R. 2.935; αὖραι εὔ. Opp. H. 4.415. Adv. - λως A.R. 2.861.
easily burning, or (cf. εὐκέατος) easily split, Ion Trag. 28.
easy to cultivate, Thphr. HP 7.7.2 (cod. Urb.).

ease of motion, mobility, Antyll. ap. Stob. 4.37.16; μελῶν Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 5.27.20; τροχιλιῶν Orib. 49.4.34; πυρός Simp. in Cael. 662.20; βάσεως Artemo 12; mobility of troops, Plb. 8.26.3, D.S. 3.49 (pl.): generally, Dam. Pr. 287.
mobility of mind, τῆς ψυχῆς αἱ εὐ. Epicur. Ep. 1p.20U., cf. Phld. Ir. p.72 W., Ath.Mech. 32.1.

easily moved, agile, Hp. Aph. 3.17, Pl. Ti. 58e; - ότατον εἶδος ib. 56a; -ότερον ψυχὴ σώματος Arist. MM 1199b32; -ότατον τὸ σφαιροειδές Id. de An. 405a12, al.; of persons, Id. HA 491b13; mobile, of troops, Plb. 1.40.7.
easily moved, changeable, Arist. Cat. 8b35; τὸ εὐ. fickleness, Hdn. 7.7.1. Adv. - τως D.S. 20.95.
easily moved, inclinable, πρὸς ἀρετήν, πρὸς ὀργήν, Arist. Cat. 13a27 ( Comp.), Rh. 1379a26; πρὸς ἀδικίαν Zaleuc. ap. Stob. 4.2.19.
Arist. Metaph. 991a16.
flowing, graceful, Phld. Po. 994.35.
ivied, Ἑλικών AP 7.407 ( Diosc.).
with beautiful pillars, αὐλαί E. Ion 185 (lyr.), cf. AP 7.648.7 ( Leon.).
with fine boughs, Quint. Ps. 47 (48).3; gloss on εὔκνημος, Sch. Nic. Th. 648; on εὔπτορθον, Suid.
easily broken, Dsc. 4.146, Ath.Mech. 18.1; gloss on εὐκέατος, Sch. Od. 5.60.

definition: εὐκλεής, ές, acc.sg. *εὐκλεέα, contr. εὐκλεᾶ Pi. P. 12.24 (- έα codd.), shortened εὐκλέᾰ Id. N. 6.29, S. OT 161 (lyr., s. v.l.), disyll., B. 5.196; dat. *εὐκλεέϊ, shortened εὐκλέῐ Pi. N. 2.24: acc. pl. *εὐκλεέας, contr. ἐϋκλεῖας Il. 10.281, Od. 21.331, shortened εὐκλέᾰς Pi. O. 2.90, Simon. 95.1; later poet. εὐκλειής Epigr.Gr. 946 ( Tralles), ἐϋκλειής A.R. 1.73; gen. εὐκλειοῦς Arch.Pap. 1.220 (ii B.C.): ( κλέος):—

children.definition: of good report, famous, freq. of persons, Od. l.c., etc.; also of things, οὐ μὰν ἧμιν ἐϋκλεὲς ἀπονέεσθαι Il. 17.415; ὀϊστοί Pi. O. 2.90, cf. N. 6.29, etc.; εὐκλέα γλῶσσαν a song that tells of his glory, B. l.c.; γόος εὐκλεὴς . . Ἀτρείδαις A. Ch. 321 (lyr.); βίου πονηροῦ θάνατος -έστερος Id. Fr. 90; -έστατος βίος E. Alc. 623, etc.: in Prose, of persons, X. Vect. 6.1 ( Comp.), HG 7.2.20 ( Sup.), Pl. Mx. 247d; δόξα εὐ. Id. Smp. 208d; later πόσῳ εὐκλέεστερον . . ; c. inf., Muson. Fr. 19p.109H.; εὐ. θάνατος Ph. 2.574 ( Sup.). Adv. - εῶς, Ep. - ειῶς, ὀλέσθαι ἐϋκλειῶς πρὸ πόληος Il. 22.110, cf. AP 6.332.8 ( Hadr.); εὐκλεῶς ἀπολέσθαι, κατθανεῖν, A. Pers. 328, Ag. 1304: Sup. εὐκλεέστατα X. Eq.Mag. 1.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Εὐκλῆς, Orphic title of Hades, IG 14.641 ( Thurii).

definition: εὔκλεια, ἡ, εὐκλείᾱ metri gr., A. Th. 685: Ep. ἐϋκλείη Il. 8.285, Od. 14.402; εὐκλεΐη IG 14.1663:—

children.definition: good repute, glory, τὸν . . ἐϋκλείης ἐπίβησον Il. l.c., cf. Antipho Soph. 49, Th. 2.44, X. An. 7.6.33, Pl. Mx. 247a, Ep. 354b, A.R. 1.141, etc.; λιπὼν . . εὔκλειαν ἐν δόμοισι A. Ch. 348 (lyr.); στέφανος εὐκλείας S. Aj. 465, E. Supp. 315; ἄγαλμα εὐκλείας S. Ant. 703.

children.label: II
children.definition: Εὔ. personified, B. 12.183, IG 3.277.

Plu. Arist. 20, Paus. 9.17.1, 2:—hence Εὔκλεια, τά, festival at Delphi, Schwyzer 323 D 7 ( Delph., v/iv B. C.): Εὔκλειος, ὁ, epith. of Zeus, B. 1.6; (sc. μήν) name of month, e.g. at Corcyra, IG 9(1).694.51, al.; at Tauromenium, ib. 14.430ii9.
bring honour to, Sapph. 118.6; praise, Tyrt. 12.24: Dor. aor. 1 εὐκλέϊξα Pi. P. 9.91, B. 6.16; πατέρα εὐκλείζων (trisyll.) ἐνὶ δήμῳ IG 1(2).1085.

definition: ἐϋκλειής, Adv. ἐϋκλειῶς, Ep. for εὐκλεής, εὐκλεῶς.

children.definition: much-famed, Arist. Fr. 640(40).
well-shut, Eust. 1937.61, Hdn. Epim. 178.

definition: ἐϋκλήϊς [ ῑ], ῑδος, ἡ, Ep. for foreg.,

children.definition: well-closed, close-shut, θύρη . . ἐϋκλήϊς, ἀραρυῖα Il. 24.318 Aristarch. ( ἐῢ κληῗσʼ (dat. pl.) Trypho).
grow luxuriantly, of vines, LXX Ho. 10.1, Ph. 1.681, Phlp. in GA 43.26.
to be fortunate, Teles p. 60 H.: c. acc. cogn., [ κλῆρον] AP 11.128 ( Pollian.).
a piece of good fortune, Antiph. 317, Teles p. 26 H., D.S. 18.13, Str. 5.3.7. ( εὐκλήρωμα is f.l. in AB 77.)
good luck in drawing lots, Lib. Decl. 16.30.
good fortune, φύσεως D.H. 3.14, cf. Ael. N A 1.54.
fortunate, LXX De. 4.20, APl. 16.296 (Antip.), Ael. Fr. 288: euphem. of the dead, BGU 1209.5 (i B. C.).
with fine twigs, πενταπέτηλον Androm. ap. Gal. 14.40.
well-spun, χιτών h.AP. 203; λίνον, νῆμα, AP 6.33 ( Maec.), 284.

well-greaved, freq. in nom. and acc. pl. ἐϋκνήμῑδες, ἐϋκνήμῑδας, in Il. always epith. of Ἀχαιοί 1.17, al.; in Od. also of ἑταῖροι, 2.402, 9.550: gen. sg. as fem., - κνήμῑδος Ἰτώνης Poet. ap. EM 519.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: with goodly spokes, ἀπήνη Nonn. D. 7.140.
with beautiful ankle, πούς AP 5.202 ( Asclep.); with handsome legs, of a statue, Plin. HN 34.82; of men, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.45; with strong calves, UPZ 121.6 (ii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., a plant in Nic. Th. 648, Al. 372.
ticklish, irritable, Man. 5.337.
easing the bowels, Diocl. Fr. 126, Plu. Sanit. 2.137a, Dsc. 2.120, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath. 9.371b ( Comp.):—hence Subst. εὐκοιλιότης, ητος, ἡ, Paul.Aeg. 3.77.
deliberating for the public weal, ἀρχά A. Supp. 700 (lyr.).
good fellowship, Stoic. 3.64, M.Ant. 11.20.
easy to deal with, εἰς χρήματα Arist. EN 1121a4, cf. Them. Or. 22.269c.
contentedness with oneʼs food, Plu. Cohib. 2.461c; ἡ περὶ τὴν δίαιταν εὐ. Id. Caes. 17: but, in earlier authors,
contentedness, good temper, Pl. Alc. 1.122c, etc.; ὀλιγόδεια καὶ εὐ. Ph. 2.457.
ease and lightness in moving, εὐ. καὶ εὐχέρεια Pl. Lg. 942d: metaph., εὐ. πρὸς τὴν ποίησιν facility in verse-making, Plu. Cic. 40; εὐ. πρήξιος AP 7.694 (Adaeus).

definition: εὐκολίδες [ εὖ] τῆς εὐκολίας ποιητικαί, Hsch.
Εὐκολίνη, ἡ, epith. of Hecate, Call. Fr. 17 P.

children.definition: well soldered, POxy. 1449.24 (iii A. D.).
gluing well, sticky, ἰκμάς AP 6.109 (Antip.).

children.label: I
children.definition: easily satisfied, contented with oneʼs food, Ἐρμείας AP 9.72 (Antip.); εὔ. τῇ διαίτῃ Plu. Lyc. 16; τὸ εὔκολον τῆς διαίτης Id. Galb. 3: but, in earlier authors,

δύσκολος, easily satisfied, contented, good-natured, ὁ δʼ εὔ. μὲν ἐνθάδʼ, εὔ. δʼ ἐκεῖ, of Sophocles, Ar. Ra. 82, cf. Arist. Rh. 1381a31: Sup., Max.Tyr. 26.2: c. dat., εὔ. πολίταις at peace with them, Ar. Ra. 359; εὔ. ἑαυτῷ Pl. R. 330a; εὔ. πρὸς τοὺς συνήθεις Plu. Fab. 1: c. inf., εὔ. φέρειν ἧτταν Id. QConv. 2.629a. Adv. - λως calmly, εὐχερῶς καὶ εὐ. ἐξέπιεν Pl. Phd. 117c, cf. Isoc. 9.3 ( v.l. - κλεῶς) ; εὐ. φέρειν τι Arist. EN 1100b31, cf. Anaxandr. 53.4; εὐ. ἔχειν Lys. 4.9; εὐθύμως καὶ εὐ. ζῆν X. Mem. 4.8.2; carelessly, διειλέχθαι Pl. Sph. 242c: Comp. - ώτερον, ἀποθανούμεθα Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.235c; - ωτέρως Steph. in Gal. 1.294 D.; also - ώτερον κρατῆσαι more easily, Polyaen. 5.13.2.
ready, agile, AP 5.205.2 ( Leon.); of soldiers, ἐλαφροί, εὔ., εὐχερεῖς Poll. 1.130; τὴν ἀναπνοὴν οὐκ εὔ. Aret. SD 1.15.
easily led, prone, πρὸς ἀδικίαν Luc. Merc.Cond. 40; -ώτεροι ταῖς ὀργαῖς Plu. Cohib. 2.463d; τὰ ἀνόητα καὶ εὔ. Philostr. VA 3.28.

children.label: II
children.definition: easy, οὐ γὰρ εὐκόλῳ ἔοικεν Pl. R. 453d, cf. Prm. 131e: Sup. - ώτατοι Id. Lg. 779e; easy to understand, LXX 2 Ki. 15.3. Adv. Comp. - ώτερον more easily, Ph. 2.211.
lithe, εὔ., ὑγρομελής, of the pyrrhich, Poll. 4.96.

children.label: III
children.definition: Hsch.; of Asclepius at Epidaurus, IG 4.1260.
with beautiful bays, Archestr. Fr. 9.3.
in goodly folds, of a net, AP 6.28 ( Jul.).
diving well, Heph.Astr. 2.2, Sch. Lyc. 387.
well cared for, νομαί Hdt. 4.53 ( Sup.), cf. Hsch.

definition: εὐκόμιστος, ον, ( κομίζω) = foreg., Poll. 9.161, Eust. 1560.6.

children.definition: easily extracted, Sor. 2.62; easily carried off, App. Mith. 90.

lovely-haired, of goddesses and noble ladies, Ep. and Lyr. form ἠΰκομος, Il. 1.36, Hes. Th. 241, Pi. O. 6.91, P. 5.45; Σελήνη Epimenid. 2: in Prose, Philostr. Ep. 29; well-fleeced, εὔκομα μῆλα AP 9.363.20 ( Mel.); with goodly foliage, δένδρεσιν ἠϋκόμοισιν Emp. 127.2, cf. Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.51.
loud-sounding, εὔκομποι πληγαὶ ποδός, in dancing, E. Tr. 152 (lyr.).
bread made with bran, Amerias and Timachidas ap. Ath. 3.114e.
enjoy an easy life, διὰ ὅλου βίου PSI 4.286.38 (iii/iv A. D.).
ease, facility, D.S. 1.36, 3.17, LXX 2 Ma. 2.25; ἐν πάσῃ εὐ. PMag.Par. 1.159.

easy, Plb. 18.18.2: mostly in Comp., -ωτέρα σκευασία Dsc. 1.39; - ώτερόν [ἐστι] c. inf., Ev.Matt. 9.5, 19.24, etc. Adv. - πως Hp. Epid. 2.6.31, Ar. Fr. 783, D.S. 3.24, Ph. Bel. 56.16: Comp. - ώτερον Antip.Stoic. 3.256.
with beautiful helmet, Opp. C. 1.363.
with handsome head, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.45: metaph., of sentences, well wound up, ending well, D.H. Dem. 40, 43.
behave orderly, LXX 1 Ma. 8.15.
well-adorned, h.Merc. 384.

orderly behaviour, good conduct, decency, E. Ba. 693, X. Cyr. 1.2.3, Arist. Pol. 1299b16, etc.; τῆς εὐ. τῆς περὶ τὸ θέατρον IG 2(2).354.16 (iv B.C.); εὐ. τοῦ θεάτρου ib. 22.223 B8; εὐ. ἡ κατὰ τὸ ἱερόν SIG 1007.24 ( Pergam., ii B.C.); εὐκοσμία τῶν παίδων Pl. Prt. 325d; ὁ ἐπὶ τῆς εὐκοσμίας καὶ τῶν παρθένων CIG 3185.19 ( Smyrna); ὁ ἐπὶ τῆς εὐ. ἄρχων IGRom. 4.582 ( Aezani).

data.quote: τῆς εὐ. τῆς περὶ τὸ θέατρον
ὁ ἐπὶ τῆς εὐκοσμίας καὶ τῶν παρθένων

children.definition: decently, περιστέλλεσθαι Anon.Hist. Oxy. 218 ii 9.

behaving well, orderly, decorous, Sol. 4.33, Th. 6.42 ( Comp.); οὐκ εὔκοσμον αἴρονται φυγήν A. Pers. 481; τὸ εὔ., = εὐκοσμία, Th. 1.84; ὁ εὔ., official title at Pergamum, IGRom. 4.353b3 (ii A.D.); at Athens, SIG 1109.94, 136 (ii A.D.).
well-adorned, τοῖχοι γραφῇσιν εὔκοσμοι Aret. CA 1.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. - μως in good order, Od. 21.123, Hes. Op. 628: Sup. - ότατα X. Cyr. 2.4.1.
ornamentally, gracefully, ξεῖν A.R. 1.1120; διαλέγεσθαι Plu. Dem. 11.
well-shorn, Hegem. ap. Ath. 15.698e.
well-poised, gloss on ῥαδαλός, EM 701.53.
a fine fig-tree, Nic. Al. 347 (v.l. εὐκραδέης, εὐκραδίης).
App.Anth. 3.292.

Od. 14.299, Hes. Op. 594); of winds, gentle, A.R. 2.1228, 4.891; ἀὴρ Thphr. CP 1.11.6, 2.3.3 (nisi leg. εὐκράς); temperate, neither too dry nor too wet, τόποι Arist. Mete. 352a7; of love, Opp. H. 4.33.

children.label: II
children.definition: Poll. 6.23 (interpol.).

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. - αῶς prob. cj. for εὐκραής in Aristaenet. 1.3.

definition: εὐκραίρης, ητος, ὁ, ἡ, = sq., Max. 84.
εὔκραιρος, Ep. ἐϋκρ-, ον, also η, ον, ( κραῖρα)

children.definition: with fine horns, esp. of oxen, βουσὶν ἐϋκραίρῃσιν h.Merc. 209; εὐκραίρῳ βοΐ A. Supp. 300.
with beautiful beak, Opp. H. 2.516, Tryph. 213.
temperate, of even temperature, κρήνη εὐκρὰς πρὸς χειμῶνα καὶ θέρος Pl. Criti. 112d; of climate, Thphr. HP 7.1.4: metaph., ἔστιν οἷς βίος ὁ μικρὸς εὐκρὰς ἐγένεθʼ E. Fr. 504; ἡδονή ib. 197.

data.quote: κρήνη εὐκρὰς πρὸς χειμῶνα καὶ θέρος

children.definition: mixed for drinking, οἶνος Poll. 6.23.
mixing readily with, οὐ πολλοῖς εὐ. AP 12.105 ( Asclep.). ( εὔκρας E. Fr. 197, Poll.)
Hsch.
good temperature, mildness, τῶν ὡρῶν Pl. Ti. 24c; τοῦ ἀέρος Plb. 34.8.4: abs., Arist. Pr. 860b12; ἐν ταῖς εὐκρασίαις in good climates, Thphr. CP 3.21.1.
εὐ. τοῦ σώματος good temperament, Arist. PA 673b25, cf. GA 744a30, Zeno Stoic. 1.37, Gal. 6.31, etc.
honey-wine, Ruf. Fr. 117, Choerob. in Theod. 1.344.
drinking of εὔκρατον, Alex.Trall. 5.5.

well-tempered, temperate, E. Fr. 772; ἐγκέφαλος Democr. ap. Thphr. Sens. 56; ἀήρ Pl. Ax. 371d; ὥρα Arist. GA 752b30; εὔκρατον ποιεῖ τὴν θερμότητα Id. PA 652b26; of countries, D.S. 1.10; τόποι Ath.Med. ap. Orib. 9.12.5 ( Sup.); οἰκήσεις Plb. 34.1.8 ( Comp.); οἶκος Aret. CA 1.1; of the temperate zone, Stoic. 2.195, etc.; μεῖξις Chrysipp. ib. 219; of liquids, tempered, lukewarm, ὕδωρ IG 5(1).1390.108 ( Andania), cf. Gal. 6.101, etc.; of wine, mixed for drinking, Arist. Pr. 874a28.
temperate, mild, ὀλιγαρχία Id. Pol. 1320b21; τὸ εὔ. τοῦ ἤθους M.Ant. 1.15; Κύπρις AP 6.208 ( Antip.Thess.): in Astrol., of beneficent planetary in fluences, Gal. 9.911.
εὔ. ἁρμονία, ἑρμηνεία, mixed style, D.H. Comp. 21 (v.l. κοινή), Dem. 3; συνθήκη ὀνομάτων Luc. Hist.Conscr. 46.

children.label: II
children.definition: εὔκρητοι πρὸς ἅπαντας (cf. εὐκράς (A) 3) Hp. Decent. 3.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. - τως temperately, ἀνδρείως καὶ εὐ. Phld. Herc. 1251.14; temperately, Gal. 1.342.
εὐ. ἔχειν to be temperate, of climate, Cleom. 1.2; to be lukewarm, Artem. 1.64.
temper, in Pass., Sch. Hes. Th. p.461 G., Sch. Lyc. 177 (- τυνθῆναι codd., Scheer).

definition: εὐκρατῶς, Adv. ( Adj. - κρᾰτής is not found)

children.definition: firmly, fast, ἔχειν τι Arist. Pr. 875a22; cf. δυσκρατής.
well-struck, well-sounding, of stringed instruments, φόρμιγξ A.R. 4.1194.
well-woven, of the threads of the warp, μίτοι AP 6.174 (Antip.<Sid.>).
with beauteous fillet, Nonn. D. 26.338.
with fair cliffs, Opp. C. 3.251.

definition: εὔκρηνος, Ep. also ἐΰκρηνος-, ον, ( κρήνη)

children.definition: well-watered, πέτρη APl. 16.230 ( Leon.); with fair fountains, πτολίεθρον Call. Aet. 3.1.72 [Fr. 75.72 Pf.].
well-based, Nonn. D. 40.258.
rich in barley, ἀλωά Theoc. 7.34; ἄρουρα AP 6.258.6 (Adaeus).
clear-sightedness, Pl. Def. 414a.
distinctness of outline, Diocl. Fr. 141.
limpidity of style, εὐ. καὶ καθαρότης Hermog. Id. 1.2, cf. 4.
clear distinction, προσώπων καὶ πραγμάτων Procl. in R. 1.15 K.
keep distinct, keep in good order, τοὺς στρατευσομένους δεῖ εὐκρινεῖν X. HG 4.2.6 (nisi leg. διευκρ-) ; τὰ εὐκρινοῦντα τὴν σύγχυσιν Hermog. Id. 1.4, cf. 11.

children.label: II
children.definition: judge fit, decide, PCair.Zen. 150.22 (iii B.C.).
well-separated, X. Eq.Mag. 3.3; well-opened, στόματα (sc. τῆς μήτρας) Hp. Mul. 1.17 (s. v.l., cf. III).

children.label: II
children.definition: distinct, clear, τῆμος δʼ εὐκρινέες τʼ αὖραι καὶ πόντος ἀπήμων then the winds are regular, steady, Hes. Op. 670; ἡ διάγνωσις εὐ. γενήσεται Is. 10.2; οὐκ εὐκρινές ἐστι πρὸς τὴν ἀκοήν there is no clear discernment, Arist. Pr. 903a17. Adv. -νῶς, ἔχειν Pl. Sph. 242c; εὐκρινέστερον ἰδεῖν Id. R. 564c; οὐκ εὐκρινῶς εἴτε . . εἴτε . . without distinction, Str. 16.4.20, cf. 6.1.11.
pellucid, opp. ἀμφίβολον, Phld. Po. 1676.8; τὸ καθαρὸν καὶ εὐ. Hermog. Id. 1.1; of authors, such as Critias and Xenophon, ib. 2.11, 12.

children.label: III
children.definition: well-arranged, in good order, Hp. Mul. 1.17 (if σώματα be read); πάντα . . εὐκρινέα ποιέεσθαι Hdt. 9.42. Adv. -νῶς, κεῖσθαι X. Oec. 8.19.
simple, not creased, Hp. Off. 10, cf. Gal. 18(2).776. Adv. - νῶς ib. 725; Ion. -νέως Hp. Off. 3.

children.label: IV
children.definition: having had a favourable crisis, convalescent, σωμάτιον Isoc. Ep. 4.11, cf. Hsch.; but, indicating a good crisis, favourable, of symptoms, Hp. Coac. 604, Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.4.2: metaph., Men. Pk. 163.
easily brought to a crisis, Hp. Aph. 3.8, Epid. 2.1.5 ( Sup.).
Hsch.: Att. use, acc. to EM 392.32.
highly sensitive, prob. f.l. for εὐκίνητος, Aret. SD 1.6.
easy to decide, οὐκ εὔ. τὸ κρῖμα A. Supp. 397; εὔ. [ἐστιν] ὅτι . . it is easily discerned, manifest, Pl. Plt. 272c, cf. d; εὔκριτʼ ἐστί Men. Epit. 136; ἴχνη distinct, Poll. 5.66.
having a good crisis, νόσημα Hp. Aph. 1.12; κρίσιες -ώτεραι Id. Acut. 14. Adv. - τως, opp. ἀνακρίτως, Pall. in Hp. 2.181 D.
pebbly, Nonn. D. 15.95.
accompanied by castanets, χορεῖαι AP 9.139 ( Claudian.); lively, rattling, πλατάγη ib. 6.309 ( Leon.).
well-hammered, well-wrought, πρόχους S. Ant. 430; Δωρίς E. El. 819.
well-sounding, ἀνάπαιστα Alciphr. 3.43. Adv. - τως Sopat. in Rh. 8.14 W.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. - τως, = εὐκροτήτως, applied to the elements in the body, Meno Iatr. 19.27.
easy to hide, Hp. Fract. 18 ( Comp.), A. Ag. 623.

definition: εὐκτάζομαι, Frequentat. of εὔχομαι, Hsch., Phot.
εὐκταῖος, α, ον, ( εὔχομαι) Att. Adj. (used chiefly by Trag., cf. ἀραῖος):

children.definition: of or for prayer, votive, Ἄιδου . . εὐκταίαν χάριν A. Ag. 1387; τρίτην Διὸς σωτῆρος εὐκταίαν λίβα Id. Fr. 55; εὐχαί Ar. Av. 1060; ἐπῳδαί Pl. Lg. 906b; εὐ. [νύμφα] devoted, E. IT 213 (lyr.); πανηγύρεις εὐ., Lat. ludi votivi, D.C. 58.12: εὐκταῖα, τά, votive offerings, vows, prayers, A. Supp. 631 (lyr.), S. Tr. 239.

invoked in or by special prayer, πατρὸς εὐκταίαν Ἐρινύν, πατρόθεν εὐκταία φάτις, of the curse invoked by Oedipus, A. Th. 723, 841 (both lyr.); Θέμις εὐκταία E. Med. 169 (anap.); τοῖσι δυστυχοῦσιν εὐκταία θεός Id. Or. 214.

prayed for, desired, ἠώς, λιμένες, AP 6.242 ( Crin.), 9.41 (Theon); γάμος γὰρ . . εὐκταῖον κακόν Men. Mon. 102, cf. Epicur. Sent.Vat. 35; desirable, f.l. for εὐκτέον in Pl. Lg. 687e: Sup., τήβεννος (of the latus clavus), AJA 18.323 ( Sardes, i B.C.); ἴασις Gal. 7.738, cf. Luc. Tyr. 17. Adv. - αίως, ἔχειν Sch. Pi. P. 5.159; δέχεσθαί τινα J. BJ 7.2.1.
wealthy, A. Pers. 897 (lyr.), AP 9.442 ( Agath.).
Thphr. HP 3.9.3 ( Comp.); δρῦς Plu. Marc. 8.
one must pray for or desire, Pl. Lg. 687e, Heraclit. Ep. 7.8; θεῷ τὰ ἄξια θεοῦ prob. cj. in Porph. Marc. 12: abs., (Max.Tyr. 11.4.
straight-grained, of wood, Thphr. HP 5.1.11.
wealth, Poll. 6.196.
wealthy, Pi. N. 7.92; εὐκτ- Paul.Al. M. 2.
of or for prayer, οἶκος Cod.Just. 1.2.15 Intr.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. εὐκτήριον, τό, oratory, Just. Nov. 131.7 Intr., Rev.Bibl. 1911.287 ( Jericho, vi A.D.).
honestly acquired, πλοῦτος Crates Theb. 10.9, cf. Paul.Al. N. 4; τἀγαθὸν εὔ. Phld. Sto. 339.4.

expressing a wish, in Gramm., ἐπίρρημα A.D. Synt. 248.6, cf. Ph. 1.541: - κή, ἡ (with or without ἔγκλισις), the optative mood, A.D. Synt. 245.27, D.T. 638.7, etc. Adv. - κῶς in the optative, Suid. s.v. ἀγαπῴην.

expressing a prayer or vow: - κόν, τό, utterance in the form of a prayer or wish, Stoic. 2.61 (pl.); εὐ. ὕμνοι Men.Rh.p.333 S.: so - κά, τά, Procl. Chr. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.320 B.; but, liturgy, Philostr. VA 6.40, S.E. M. 8.72. Adv. - κῶς in the form of a prayer, Theon Prog. 5.

good to dwell in, epith. of cities, ἐϋ. πτολίεθρον Il. 2.501, etc.; πόλις B. 5.149; of anything on which manʼs labour has been bestowed, νῆσον ἐϋκτιμένην ἐκάμοντο wrought it so as to be good to dwell in, Od. 9.130; ἐϋ. ἐν ἀλωῇ on a well-made threshing-floor, Il. 20.496, 21.77; the same phrase, of a garden, well-wrought, Od. 24.226. ( εὐκτ- in h.Ap. 36, B. l.c.)

definition: εὔκτιστος, ον, poet. ἐΰκτ-, ( κτίζω) = foreg., Sch. Hes. Sc. 270.

children.definition: Il. 2.592, = h.Ap. 423, cf. D.P. 552; πόλις Hes. Fr. 81.5; μέγαρα B. 3.46. (Glossed by εὐκατοίκητος (q.v.).)
wished for, desired, ὄφρʼ ἔτι μᾶλλον Τρωσὶ μὲν εὐκτὰ γένηται that what they wish for may happen, Il. 14.98; τὰ δʼ εὐκτὰ παρὰ θεῶν ᾐτησάμην S. Fr. 843.

data.quote: τὰ δʼ εὐκτὰ παρὰ θεῶν ᾐτησάμην

children.definition: to be wished for, εὐκτὸν ἀνθρώποισι E. Ion 642, cf. Isoc. 12.243, Men. Georg. 82; εὐ. ὁ τῶ βατράχω βίος Theoc. 10.52; εὐκτότατος γάμος Eup. 383: εὐκτόν ἐστι c. inf., E. Heracl. 458, X. Mem. 1.5.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: vowed, dedicated, ἴουλος AP 10.19 ( Apollonid.).
clattering, Q.S. 5.21.
to be lucky with the dice, Amphis 11.
= sq., Ἀληθείη Parm. 1.29.

well-rounded, round, in Il. always of ἀσπίς, 5.453, 797, al., A. Th. 590; εὔ. ἕδρα Pi. N. 4.66; σφαίρη Parm. 8.43; στεφάναι X. Cyn. 9.12; εὔκυκλον ποιεῖν Pl. Ti. 40a; ὀφθαλμοὶ σελήνης -ότεροι Alciphr. Fr. 5.
Od. as epith. of ἀπήνη, well-wheeled, 6.58, 70; ὄχοι A. Pr. 710; ἀντίπηξ E. Ion 1391.
in horizontal circles, orbicular, Heliod. ap. Orib. 48.61 tit., Gal. 18(1).786.

children.label: II
children.definition: moving in a circle, circling, χορεία Ar. Th. 968 (lyr.). Adv. -λως Orph. L. 135.
well-rounded, Eub. 56.4, Aristopho 14.
suited to the wine-cup, λαλιή AP 7.440.8 ( Leon.).
easily rolled, Hero Aut. 2.4, Phlp. in Ph. 647.2. Adv. -τως Hero Aut. 11.11.
easily made to undulate, ἐποχαί Nicom. Harm. 3 ( Comp.).

children.label: II
children.definition: strong-surging, εἰς θυμόν Eust. 1392.49.
well-equipt with oars, Opp. H. 5.242; gloss on εὔσελμος, Hsch.

definition: εὐλάβεια [ λᾰ], ἡ, Ion. -ιη Thgn. 118, Agatho in PLG ii p.268 B.:—

children.definition: discretion, caution, Thgn. l.c., Agatho l.c., etc.; ἐσῴζετʼ ἂν τὴν -ειαν S. El. 994; personified in E. Ph. 782; ἡ εὐ. σῴζει πάντα Ar. Av. 376; εὐλάβειαν ἔχειν μή . . , = εὐλαβεῖσθαι μή . . , Pl. Prt. 321a; so εὐ. αὕτη . . τὸ μὴ νέους . . γεύεσθαι caution to prevent their tasting, Id. R. 539b; εὐλαβείας οὐ μικρᾶς δεῖται, εὐ. ἐστὶ πολλῆς, D. 19.262, Arist. Pol. 1269a14; εὐ. ποιητέον περί τινας ib. 1315a17; διʼ εὐλαβείας ἔχειν ἀλλήλους D.H. 5.38; ἐπʼ εὐλαβεία . . προείρηται by way of caution, Pl. R. 539d; ἐπʼ εὐ. in A. Ag. 1024 is f.l. for ἐπʼ ἀβλ., cf. Sch. ad loc.

caution or discretion in a thing, πολλὴ εὐ. τούτων ποιητέα Antipho 3.3.11; εὐλάβειαι πληγῶν avoidance of . . , Pl. Lg. 815a; τῶν αἰσχρῶν Arist. EN 1121b24; ηὑλάβεια τῶν ποιουμένων S. OC 116; εὐλάβειαν τῶνδε προυθέμην Id. El. 1334; ἡ τῶν περιεχόντων εὐ. careful employment of . . , Phld. D. 3 Fr. 32.

reverence, piety, πρὸς or περὶ τὸ θεῖον, D.S. 13.12, Plu. Num. 22 (but also πρός τινα Ph. 2.581): abs., godly fear, Ep.Hebr. 5.7, 12.28; religious scruple, οὐδεμίαν εὐ. προορωμένων UPZ 42.21 (ii B.C.).

children.label: b
children.definition: ἡ σὴ εὐ. your reverence, PFlor. 73.7 (vi A.D.).
over-caution, timidity, Plu. Fab. 1, 2.432e; εὐλαβίη γὰρ ἀπειρίη Aret. CA 1.2.

definition: εὐλαβέομαι, impf. ηὐλαβούμην v.l. in E. Or. 748 (troch.), 1059, εὐλ- Aeschin. 1.25: fut. - ήσομαι Pl. R. 410a, Arist. EN 1127b6; also- ηθήσομαι LXX De. 2.4, al., D.L. 7.116, Gal. 5.249: aor. ηὐλαβήθην (or εὐλ-) Pl. Phd. 89c:—

children.definition: to be discreet, cautious, beware, folld. by μή or ὅπως μή with subj., εὐ. μὴ φανῇς κακὸς γεγώς S. Tr. 1129, cf. E. Hipp. 100, Ar. Eq. 253, Pl. Phd. 89c, etc.: by fut. ind., ὅπως μὴ . . οἰχήσομαι ib. 91c (om. cod. B): c. inf., εὐλαβουμένῳ πεσεῖν S. OT 616; εὐ. λέγειν Pl. Phd. 101c: with μή inserted, εὐ. μὴ σῴζειν φίλους E. Or. 1059, cf. Ar. Lys. 1277, Cydias 1.

take care, ὅπως κατοίσεις Ar. Ach. 955; εὐ. περί τι Pl. Lg. 927c, Ion 537a; περί τινος Id. Lg. 691b; ἀμφί τινι Luc. Gall. 21: abs., εὐλαβήθηθʼ S. OT 47; εὐλαβούμενος ἠρόμην Pl. Prt. 333e, cf. 316d; εἰ μηδὲν εὐλαβηθέντα τἀληθὲς εἰπεῖν δέοι without reserve, D. 18.159; take precautions, Arist. Pol. 1303b27.
incur risk, εὐλαβήθη περὶ καθαιρέσεως δόξης Vett.Val. 231.19, cf. 209.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: have a care of, beware of, εὐλαβοῦ στρόμβον . . μή σʼ ἀναρπάσῃ A. Fr. 195; εὐ. τὴν κύνα ‘ware the dog, Ar. Lys. 1215; εὐ. πενίαν Pl. R. 372c; τὸν φθόνον D. 18.305; τὸ ψεῦδος Arist. EN 1127b6; τοὺς ὑβρίζεσθαι νομίζοντας Id. Pol. 1315a27; τὰς μυίας Id. HA 611b11.

reverence, pay honour to, τὸν θεόν Pl. Lg. 879e; τὸν δῆμον Plu. Per. 7; in LXX, fear God, Na. 1.7; εὐ. ἀπὸ τοῦ ὀνόματος Κυρίου Ze. 3.12; μηδὲν-ούμενον, ὡς οἱ πολλοὶ λέγουσιν, ὅτι . . δεῖ . . Sor. 1.49.

data.quote: μηδὲν-ούμενον, ὡς οἱ πολλοὶ λέγουσιν, ὅτι . . δεῖ . .

children.definition: watch for, await quietly, καιρόν E. Or. 699.
put out of harmʼs way, τὰ κοῖλα γαστρός Id. Ph. 1411.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., εὐλαβεῖν τινα beware of, BGU 665.4 (i A.D.); cf. εὐλάβησον, -ῆσαι, Phot.
taking hold well, holding fast, clinging, metaph., πενία Luc. Tim. 29: lit. in Adv. εὐλαβῶς, κατέχειν Ael. NA 3.13, 6.55 ( Sup.): but mostly,

children.label: II
children.definition: undertaking prudently, discreet, cautious, Democr. 91, Pl. Plt. 311a, al.; τὸ εὐλαβές, = εὐλάβεια, ib.b; εὐλαβὴς περί τι Plu. CG 3; τὸ πρὸς τὰ μεγάλα τῶν τετολμημένων εὐ. Hdn. 2.8.2; εὐ. ἀπό τινος keeping from . . , LXX Le. 15.31. Adv. -βῶς Pl. Sph. 246b; εὐ. διακείμενος D.S. 13.12, etc.: Comp. - εστέρως E. IT 1375; -έστερον διακεῖσθαι πρός τι Plb. 1.18.1.
reverent, pious, LXX Mi. 7.2 (v.l. εὐσεβής), Ev.Luc. 2.25, Act.Ap. 2.5, etc.: Sup. - έστατος, as title, Dionys. Ep. 71, Procop.Gaz. Ep. 126.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., easy to get hold of, κέρκος Luc. Lex. 7.
cautiously undertaken or effected, μετάβασις Pl. Lg. 736d; ἡδοναί Plu. Per. 15 ἀβλ-Reiske).
one must beware of, c. acc., Pl. R. 608a, Grg. 527b, cf. 480e, Epicur. Fr. 465, Dsc. Eup. 2.160, etc.
verecundus, Gloss.
careful to avoid, Pl. Def. 412a; ὀρθοῦ ψόγου Stoic. ap. Stob. 2.7.5b2.
Hsch.
εὔλιθος, τράπεζα AP 9.767 ( Agath.); σορός ib. 7.605 ( Jul.), cf. Coluth. 46, Nonn. D. 5.134.

definition: εὐλάκα, ἡ, Dor. word, ἀργυρέᾳ εὐλάκᾳ εὐλαξεῖν ( Lacon. fut. inf.),

children.definition: should plough with silver ploughshare, intimating that there would be a dearth, corn being worth its weight in silver, Orac. ap. Th. 5.16 (v.l. εὐλάχα, Phot.).—Neither Verb nor Noun occurs elsewh. (Cf. αὐλάχα, αὖλαξ.)
sweetly-speaking, LXX Si. 6.5; epith. of Apollo, AP 9.525.6; of the Argo, Orph. A. 244: metaph., of a wine-jar, AP 9.229 ( Marc.Arg.).

children.label: II
children.definition: LXX Jb. 11.2.
bright-shining, Max. 582, Max.Tyr. 17.10 ( Sup.); ὀφθαλμοί Adam. 1.8; τὸ εὐ. ib. 19:—also εὔλαμπρος, ον, v.l. for εὔχαλκος in Antiph. 208.2.
fruitful in herbs, AP 7.321.6; τόποι Gp. 12.3.3.
easily triturated, Xenocr. 42; τροφή Arist. PA 674b33: Comp., Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.13.12:
easily powdered, Gal. 12.189, Asclep. ap. eund. 13.678.

definition: εὔλειμος, ον, = sq., E. Ba. 1084 codd. (prob. ὕλιμος).

children.definition: with goodly meadows, οὐ γάρ τις νήσων ἱππήλατος οὐδʼ εὐ. Od. 4.607, cf. h.Ap. 529, Hes. Fr. 134.
bringing wedded happiness, of Aphrodite, S. Tr. 515 (lyr.), AP 5.244 ( Maced.).
a beauteous bride, S. Ant. 796 (lyr.).
with good choice of words, ridiculed by Luc. Lex. 1, Rh.Pr. 17.
easily peeled or shelled, βάλανος Dsc. 4.157.
AP 7.649 ( Anyte); Κύπρις APl. 16.182 ( Leon.).

worm, maggot, the larva of the fly (rarely in sg., AP 7.472.10 ( Leon.)), different fr. ἕλμινς; Hom. only in Il., of worms bred in flesh, 19.26, 24.414, al.; ὑπʼ εὐλέων καταβρωθῆναι Hdt. 3.16, cf. 4.205, Hp. Mul. 1.75, Pl. Ax. 365c, Arist. HA 506a30:—of common worms, Orph. L. 600.
soon ceasing, Luc. Trag. 324.
to be of good spirit, A. Fr. 106.
fleecy, EM 393.6, Hsch.

easily taken hold of, οὐδʼ εὔληπτον εἶναι τὸ ὕδωρ J. AJ 1.16.2, cf. Gal. UP 11.5 ( Sup.). Adv., τὸ ἔκπωμα εὐληπτότατα ἐνδιδόναι to give it so that one can most easily take hold of it, X. Cyr. 1.3.8: metaph., εὔ. τὰ τῆς διατριβῆς Iamb. VP 7.33.

easy to be taken or reduced, νησιῶται Th. 6.85; ἧττον εὔ. πόλις D.H. 3.43; εὔ. ὀργῇ, κόλαξι, Ph. 2.590, Plu. Adul. 2.66b; easy to gain or obtain, Luc. Merc.Cond. 10; easy to apprehend, τοῖς ἀκούουσι Iamb. Protr. 4.
reins, Il. 23.481, Q.S. 4.508, 9.156; Dor. αὔληρα Epich. 178 (for ἀϝληρα, cf. ἀβληρά Hsch.):—hence εὐληρωσίων ( εὐληροσιῶν cod.). πληγῶν, Id. (Cf. ταυληρόντα.)

definition: εὔλητο ἐπέφυρτο, ἐτετάρακτο, Hsch. (Perh. for ἐόλητο.)

children.definition: rich in frankincense, Aristonous 1.23, Orph. H. 55.17.
of goodly stone, ἄντρον Orph. H. 59.4; made of fair stones, J. BJ 5.5.6.

with good harbours, ἀκταί E. Hel. 1463; [ πόλις] εὐλιμενωτέρα Pl. Lg. 705a, cf. 704b, 704d; εὐ. ἁλὸς οἶκοι Archestr. Fr. 26: c. gen., ἱερὸν παντὸς κύματος εὐλίμενον App.Anth. 3.81 ( Posidipp.): —also εὐλῐμήν, - ένος, πορθμοί Procop. Aed. 1.5.
good harbourage, Men.Rh. p.352S.
abounding in lakes, Arist. HA 601b22.
spinning well, epith. of Ilithyia, Olen ap. Paus. 8.21.3.
very fat, Lyc. 874.
rich in resin, πεύκη Epigr. ap. Philostr. Her. 19.17.
easily entreated, Sch. A.R. 1.1141.

definition: εὐλογέω, impf. εὐλόγουν or ηὐλ- Ar. Ec. 454, Isoc. 12.206: fut. - ήσω E. Hec. 465 (lyr.): aor. εὐλόγησα or ηὐλ- LXX Ge. 1.22, al.: inf. εὐλογῆσαι Ar. Eq. 565: pf. εὐλόγηκα LXX Nu. 23.11:— Pass., with fut. Med. εὐλογήσομαι ( v.l. - ηθήσομαι, as always in LXX, 2 Ki. 7.29, al.) Isoc. 9.5: aor. εὐλογήθην Phalar. Ep. 119.3 (opt.): pf. εὐλόγημαι LXX Ru. 2.19:—

children.definition: speak well of, praise, πόλιν A. Ag. 580; πατέρα τὸν ἀμόν S. Ph. 1314, cf. Ar. Eq. 1.c., E. Hec. 1.c., al., Isoc.ll.cc.; deliver a panegyric upon, Arist. Rh.Al. 1426a3: with neut. Adj., εὐ. καὶ δίκαια κἄδικα Ar. Ach. 372, cf. Ec. 454; θεοὶ εὐλογοῦσί τινα honour him, E. Supp. 927:— Pass., ἐπαίνοις εὐλογούμενον πέδον S. OC 720; τὸν ἐν Δωδῶνι δαίμονʼ εὐλογούμενον Id. Fr. 461.

children.label: II
children.definition: LXX Ge. 35.9, al., Act.Ap. 3.26, al.: freq. in pf. part. Pass. εὐλογημένος, as LXX De. 28.3, Ev.Luc. 1.28.
bless, praise a god, OGI 73 ( Egypt), cf. εὐ. τὴν Εἶσιν (sic) CIG 4705c (ibid.); σου τὰς δυνάμεις Buresch Aus Lydien 113; so in LXX and NT, Jo. 22.23, al., Ep.Jac. 3.9.
curse, LXX 3 Ki. 20(21).10, cf. Jb. 2.5.
blessed, LXX Ge. 9.26, al., Ph. 1.453, Ev.Luc. 1.68, Ep.Rom. 1.25, etc.
good or fine language, Pl. R. 400d, Luc. Lex. 1.
plausibility, ἔχει τινὰ εὐλογίαν Thphr. CP 6.31.1; habet εὐλογίαν Cic. Att. 13.22.4, cf. Ep.Rom. 16.18; ἡ τοῦ δόγματος εὐ. prob. in Phld. Sign. 27; ἡ εὐ. τῶν πραγμάτων Id. Herc. 1251.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: praise, eulogy, Pi. N. 4.5, Th. 2.42; ὑμνῆσαι διʼ εὐλογίας E. HF 356 (lyr.); ἄξιος εὐλογίας Ar. Pax 738: pl., Pi. I. 3.3, 6(5).21, Pl. Ax. 365a; good fame, glory, ἀγήραντος εὐ. Simon. 100, cf. Pi. O. 5.24; εὐλογίαν φέρει Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 21.10; ἔχειν εὐ. τινὰ πρός τινα POxy. 65.4 (iii/iv A.D.).
praise to God, LXX Si. 50.20(22), Apoc. 7.12, OGI 74 ( Egypt).

children.label: III
children.definition: act of blessing, opp. κατάρα, LXX Ge. 27.12, Ep.Jac. 3.10.
blessing called down or bestowed, LXX Pr. 10.22, 1 Ep.Pet. 3.9.
gift, bounty, LXX Jo. 15.19, 4 Ki. 5.15, 2 Ep.Cor. 9.5; ὁ σπείρων ἐπʼ εὐλογίαις ἐπʼ εὐλογίαις καὶ θερίσει bountifully, ib. 6, cf. Ph. 1.129.
v.l. in LXX To. 4.12:— Pass., v.l. in Ph. 1.395.
benedictus, Gloss.
act rationally, prudently, Diog.Bab.Stoic. 3.219, Antip.ib. 253, Ph. 1.395; ἔν τινι D.L. 7.88, Arr. Epict. 2.23.35; πρός τι Plu. Oth. 13, etc.
circumspection, prudence, Pl. Def. 412e, Stoic. 3.64, Antip. ib. 253, Phld. D. 3 Fr. 81, Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.103a, M.Ant. 4.26, Phalar. Ep. 119.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: blessing, Ph. 1.597, al.
easily computed, hence of ratios, simple, Arist. Sens. 439b32; opp. περιττός, Id. Metaph. 1092b27; πληθύς D.H. 4.15.

well-weighed, αἰτίαι Id. 1.4; well-calculated, reasonable, ὁδός Id. 5.55; rational, ἐκλογή Antip.Stoic. 3.253, Chrysipp. ib. 46; λόγος Phld. Rh. 2.160 S.; τῶν ἀλγεινῶν ὑπομονή Hierocl. in CA 11p.441M.
probable, Phld. Lib. p.27 O.
blessed, Ph. 1.46, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., calculating well or rightly: hence, prudent, circumspect, ἀνδρὸς τὸ κρατέειν (sc. θυμοῦ) εὐλογίστου Democr. 236, cf. Arist. Rh. 1385b27, Plb. 10.2.7, Phld. Ir. p.81 W., etc.: Sup., Ph. 1.644; τὸ εὐ, = εὐλογιστία, Arr. Epict. 1.11.17, Ps.- Dsc. 1.103. Adv. - τως rationally, opp. ἀλογίστως, Epicur. Ep. 3p.66U.; prudently, wisely, κεχρῆσθαι τοῖς καιροῖς Plb. 18.33.7 ( Sup.); εὐ. φέρειν D.H. 4.21, cf. Arr. Epict. 3.2.2, M.Ant. 8.32.
excuse, Sch. E. Hec. 1187, Eust. 1233.54.

reasonable, sensible, νουθετήματα A. Pers. 830; οὐκ εὐλόγῳ ἔοικεν Pl. R. 605e; εὔ. ὀργή Phld. Ir. p.45 W.; εὔλογόν [ἐστι] c. inf., it is reasonable that . . , Pl. Cra. 396b, Arist. Pol. 1286b15, etc.; - ώτερόν [ἐστι] Id. EN 1102b2: Sup., Id. Cael. 286b34.
reasonable, fair, πρόφασις Th. 3.82, D. 18.152, etc.; τὸ εὔ. a fair reason, Th. 4.87.

probable, c. dat. et inf., Hp. de Arte 7 ( Comp.), cf. Sphaer.Stoic. 1.141, Cic. Att. 14.22.2; διὰ σημείων εὐ. Phld. Lib. p.30 O.; ἐκ τῶν εὐ. in all probability, Plb. 10.44.6, cf. Plu. Them. 13; ἐκτὸς τῶν εὐ. πίπτειν to be beyond all probability, Arist. Metaph. 1060a18: Comp., Pl. Ep. 352a: Sup., Cic. Att. 13.6.4. Adv. - γως Phld. Lib. p.33 O.
suitable, conformable, c. dat., Plot. 6.5.10.
creditable, κατορθώσασι εὔ. [ἐστί] Ar. Ra. 736.
eloquent, v.l. for ἱκανός, LXX Ex. 4.10, whence Ezek. Exag. 113, Ph. 2.93, 1.166 (interpr. as reasonable).

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. - γως with good reason, reasonably, A. Th. 508, Supp. 47 (lyr.), Fr. 6, Ar. V. 771, Lys. 12.7; εὐ. ἄπρακτοι ἀπίασιν Th. 4.61; εὐ. φέρειν (Abresch εὐλόφως, q.v.) E. Fr. 175; εὐ. ἔχειν Pl. Phd. 62d; εὐ. φθονεῖν τινι Alex. 219.1; τοῖς εὐ. καὶ τοῖς κακῶς ἔχουσι Men. 48; freq. like εἰκότως, at the close of a sentence, implying assent, Arist. EN 1153b15, 1162b6: Comp. - ωτέρως Isoc. 6.28; - ώτερον Plb. 7.7.7.

data.quote: τοῖς εὐ. καὶ τοῖς κακῶς ἔχουσι

children.definition: εὐ. τινὰ ἐπιδέξασθαι (v.l. ἐνδόξως) honourably, LXX 1 Ma. 12.43.
seeming probable, Doxop. in Rh. 2.316 W., Sch. S. OC 761.
to be lucky, prob. in Hsch. for εὐλογεῖν· εὐμοιρεῖν.
fortunate, propitious, Democr. 166.
open to reproach, Men. 439, Plu. Amat. 2.757a.
to be eaten of worms, Artem. 5.81.
well-plumed, κυνῆ S. Aj. 1286, cf. Fr. 341; κράνος Hld. 7.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: taking the yoke well, strong, patient, opp. δύσλοφος, νῶτον Lyc. 776; αὐχήν Dam. Isid. 89. Adv. - φως, ὑποφέρειν τι Phld. Mort. 35; φέρειν Dam. Isid. 190, Eust. 1653.6; ἀγωνίζεσθαι Anon. ap. Suid.
glorious progeny, Hymn.Is. 156.
helping in childbirth, of Artemis, E. Hipp. 166 (lyr.); Εἰλήθυια Call. Epigr. 54.
flexible, EM 530.56, Eust. 73.19.
Sapph. 44.33 L.-P., B. Scol.Oxy. 1361 Fr. 12, E. Alc. 570 (lyr.), Ar. Th. 969 (lyr.), Limen. 4.

definition: εὐλυρία, ἡ, dub. l. in PMag.Leid.V. 8.8 (fort. εὐμυρία,

children.definition: skilled in the lyre, of Apollo, E. Fr. 477; of the Muses, Ar. Ra. 229 (lyr.); of a harper, IG 14.1663.
suppleness, ease of movement, D.L. 6.70, Muson. Fr. 19p.107H.; εὐ. κοιλίας a healthy motion of the bowels, Cic. Fam. 16.18.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: release, redemption, opp. στένωσις, PFlor. 296.21 (vi A.D.).
discharge a debt, prob. in Hsch. s.v. καταθεῖναι τὴν τιμήν.
discharge of a debt, B Mus.Inscr. 4.481*. 307 ( Ephesus).
easy to untie or loose, X. Cyn. 6.12; ὑποδέσεις D.S. 15.44; loose, θύραι στροφὰς ἔχουσαι εὐ. Id. 3.22.
easy to relax, relaxed, διαχωρήσιες Hp. Prog. 18, cf. Arist. Pr. 876b31.
loosely knit, supple, of joints, Id. Phgn. 809b26 ( Comp.), 811a1; loose, of a machine, Hero Aut. 26.3.

soluble, easily dissolved, Dsc. 5.159; σπλήν friable, Aret. SD 1.14; soft, yielding, of the os uteri, Hp. Mul. 2.115: hence metaph., easily dissolved or broken, στέργηθρα E. Hipp. 256 (anap.); of engagements, X. HG 5.2.19; of health, Gal. 5.443; of problems, easy to solve, Arist. GA 755b23, Just. Nov. 97.6 Intr.
easily released, of the foetus, εὐ. πρὸς τὸν τόκον Hp. Septim. 4 ( Comp.): so metaph., στόμα εὔ. πρὸς λοιδορίαν Thphr. Char. 6.10.

children.label: b
children.definition: free from burdens, at ease, Jul. Caes. 315b.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. - τως easily, freely, οὖρα οὐκ εὐ. ἰόντα Hp. Coac. 446; εὐ. στρέφεσθαι Hero Aut. 18.1; εὐ. [πέλτην] μεταφέρειν D.S. 5.34; loosely, ἐναγκυλίζεσθαι Plb. 27.11.5.

definition: εὐλυτόω, aor. 1 imper. εὐλύτωσον· ἀπάλλαξον, Hsch.
εὔλωστοι ( -λαστ- cod.): εὐυφεῖς, Hsch.; cf. λωστός, λῶμα.

children.definition: readiness in learning, docility, Pl. R. 490c, Arist. Rh. 1362b24, Call. Fr. 32 P., etc.: pl., Ph. 1.326: also in poet. form εὐμαθία, Pl. Chrm. 159e, Men. 88a: Ion. -ιη AP 6.325 ( Leon.Alex.), al.
ready or quick at learning, opp. δυσμαθής, Pl. R. 486c, al.; τινος Id. Ep. 344a; πρός τι D. 24.17 ( Comp.). Adv. -θῶς, παρακολουθεῖν Aeschin. 1.116: Comp. - έστερον Pl. Lg. 723a.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., easy to learn or know, intelligible, A. Eu. 442, Arist. Rh. 1409b4; εὐ. φώνημα well-known, S. Aj. 15; εὔγνωστα καὶ εὐ. X. Oec. 20.14, cf. S. Tr. 614: Comp., διήγησις Plb. 14.12.5.
easily moulded, Dsc. 1.97; gloss on εὔστρεπτος, Eust. 1453.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: liquid, of consonants, EM 700.24.
of fine wool, μίτρα Pi. I. 5(4).62.
abounding in fennel, AP 9.318 ( Leon.).
soon withering, Artem. 1.77.

definition: εὐμάρεια [ ᾰ], ἡ, ( Ion. dat. εὐμαρέη is found in Hdt. 2.35 codd., cited by Greg.Cor. p.521 S., Suid.), also εὐμαρ-ία Pl. Ly. 204d, but Ion. acc. εὐμαρίην only as v.l. for - είην in Hdt. 4.113: -

children.definition: easiness, ease, opportunity, τινι for doing a thing, E. Fr. 181; but more commonly τινος, S. Ph. 284, 704 (lyr.); εὐ. φυγῆς Anon. ap. Suid.; τῆς ζητήσεως Arist. Pol. 1276a24.
ease of movement, dexterity, χεροῖν E. Ba. 1128, cf. Arist. Mu. 398b35.

ease, comfort, εὐμαρείᾳ χρώμενος πολλῇ S. Tr. 193; but also εὐμαρείῃ ( -έῃ codd.) χρᾶσθαι euphem. for alvum exonerare, to ease oneself, Hdt. 2.35, cf. 4.113; εὐ. παρασκευάζειν to provide easy or ready means, Pl. Lg. 738d; πρὸς τὰς ἐκ Διὸς ὥρας εὐ. μηχανᾶσθαι provision for, protection against, Id. Prt. 321a; εὐ. ἐστί c. inf., it is easy to . . , Id. Ly. l.c., X. Oec. 5.9; διʼ εὐμαρείας easily, Luc. Am. 13; κατὰ πολλὴν εὐ., μετὰ πάσης εὐ., Ph. 2.428, 1.670; πρὸς εὐμάρειάν τινος for his convenience, Luc. Hipp. 5; ἐν πάσῃ εὐ. εὐθὺς γίνεται M.Ant. 4.3.
have abundance, πάντων B. 1.65.

easy, convenient, most commonly of things, εὐμάρεα προλέξαις Alc. Supp. 22.7; εὐ. χείρωμα an easy prey, A. Ag. 1326; δυστυχούντων γʼ εὐμαρὴς ἀπαλλαγή Id. Supp. 339; ἔνθεσις Pherecr. 108.6: Comp., Ph. 1.19, Ascl. Tact. 7.3; εὔμαρές [ἐστι] c. inf., ‘tis easy, Sapph. Supp. 5.5, Thgn. 845, Simon. 125.5, Pi. P. 3.115, N. 3.21, E. Alc. 492; so ἐν εὐμαρεῖ [ἐστι] Id. IA 969, Hel. 1227, Fr. 382.10; [ Ἡράκλειαν] ἐξ εὐμαροῦς ἔλαβεν Phleg. Mir. 3.

children.label: b
children.definition: easy to obtain, abundant, cheap, σῖτος IG 12 (5).714.15 ( Andros, iv B.C., Comp.).
bringing ease, χρόνος γὰρ εὐ. θεός S. El. 179 (lyr.); gentle, Aret. SD 1.6: Comp. - έστερος more ‘in touch’, Hp. Decent. 13.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. - ρῶς, poet.- ρέως, easily, readily, πείθομαι B. 5.195, cf. A. Fr. 366, Pl. Criti. 113e, Lg. 706b, Luc. Am. 53, Sor. 1.33, etc.; τλήσεται εὐ. AP 5.245 ( Paul.Sil.): Comp. - έστερον Trag.Adesp. 383, Hdn. 8.7.6: Sup. - έστατα Ph. 2.419; εὐμαρέως τοι χρῆμα θεοὶ δόσαν οὔτε τι δειλὸν οὔτʼ ἀγαθόν Thgn. 463. (From μάρη = χείρ (cf. εὐχερής) Sch. Il. 15.137.) [ ᾰ, for καταφαγῆμεν εὐμᾰρέα shd. be read in Epich. 42.]

data.quote: εὐμαρέως τοι χρῆμα θεοὶ δόσαν οὔτε τι δειλὸν οὔτʼ ἀγαθόν

definition: εὔμαρις [later ᾰ (v. infr.)], ιδος, ἡ, acc. εὔμᾱριν A. Pers. 660 (lyr.); but acc. pl. εὐμᾱρίδας (sic) Lyc. 855 (on the accent, v. Hdn.Gr. 1.99): —

children.definition: an Asiatic shoe or slipper (made of deerskin, Poll. 7.90), βαρβάροις ἐν εὐμάρισι E. Or. 1370 (lyr.); κροκόβαπτον . . εὔμαριν ἀείρων A. l.c.; βαθύπελμος εὔμᾰρις AP 7.413 (Antip.), cf. Lyc. l.c. (Prob. a foreign word.)
Callistr. Stat. 3.

definition: εὐμάχανος [ μᾱ], ον, Dor. for εὐμήχανος.

children.definition: easy to fight against, assailable, Max.Tyr. 26.2 ( Sup.).
of good size, large, Ar. Pl. 543, Eub. 110; ἀστράγαλος Aen.Tact. 31.17; ποταμὸς μάλα εὐ. X. HG 5.2.4; tall, γυνή AP 5.37 ( Nicarch.), cf. PLips. 1.3 (ii B.C.), etc.
considerable, weighty, important, μαρτυρία D. 23.16; πρᾶγμα Ph. 2.196.

definition: εὐμέζεος ( -μάξεως cod.): εὐφυὴς ( ἐφυεὶς cod.) τοῖς αἰδοίοις, Hsch.
εὐμεθόδευτος, ον, = sq. II, Ptol. Alm. 1.10;

children.definition: having a good method, ἰατρός Steph. in Hp. 2.317 D.

easily compassed or discovered, Archim. Spir.Praef.; well-arranged , τὸ εὐ. Lyd. Mag. 3.53, Olymp. in Alc. p.131 C., Alex.Trall. Praef. Adv. - δως Id. 1.11, Aristaenet. 1.13, Hierocl. in CA Praef. p.416 M.

children.label: II
children.definition: scientific, ἰατρός Alex.Trall. 1.12.
easily made drunk, Gp. 7.34.2.
smiling, propitious, A.R. 4.715, Call. Dian. 129.
easily appeased, Corn. ND 12:—also εὐμειλής, ές, and εὐμ<ε>ίλῐχος, ον, Hsch.
with fair halls, Trag.Adesp. in Gött.Nachr. 1922.25.
well-blackened, inky, βροχίς AP 6.295.4 ( Phan.).
melody, D.S. 4.84, Plu. Cohib. 2.456b, etc.
melodious language, Longin. 28.2; v.l. for ἐμμέλεια, D.H. Comp. 18; εὐ. φωνῆς Phld. Rh. 1.196S.
melodious, μουσική Arist. Pol. 1341b26, Sopat. 10; opp. ἐμμελής (metrical), D.H. Comp. 11, etc.: generally, agreeable, συμπόσια Pl. Ax. 371d. Adv. - λῶς gracefully, Macho ap. Ath. 13.577d.

children.label: II
children.definition: with stout limbs, Ael. Fr. 110.
to have a good stock of honey, Arist. HA 625a24, Thphr. HP 6.2.3.

definition: εὐμένεια, ἡ, poet. εὐμεν-ία Pi. P. 12.4:—

children.definition: goodwill, favour, ἡμῖν . . παρὰ τῶν θεῶν . . εὐ. εἴη Hdt. 2.45, cf. S. OC 631, E. Hel. 313, X. Ap. 7, Pl. Smp. 197d, etc.; ἡ πρὸς τὸ θεῖον εὐ. the favour of the gods (v. πρός) Th. 5.105; ἡ συναντωμένη τισὶν εὐ. παρὰ τοῦ δαιμονίον SIG 601.14 ( Teos, ii B.C.); ἐπʼ εὐμενείᾳ to gain favour, Luc. Tox. 1; σὺν εὐμενίᾳ kindly, Pi. l.c.

data.quote: ἡμῖν . . παρὰ τῶν θεῶν . . εὐ. εἴη
ἡ συναντωμένη τισὶν εὐ. παρὰ τοῦ δαιμονίον

children.label: II
children.definition: pleasantness, Thphr. CP 6.14.12.
Adj. of Εὐμένης, pr. n. of two kings of Pergamum, στρατιῶται Polyaen. 4.6.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: Εὐμένεια, τά, festival in honour of Eumenes II of Pergamum, at Pergamum, OGI 267.34; at Aegina, ib. 329.40; at Sardes, ib. 305.9.

definition: Εὐμένειος, ὁ (sc. - μήν), name of month at Pergamum, OGI 338.2.
εὐμενέτης, ου, ὁ, poet. for εὐμενής,

children.definition: well-wisher, χάρματα δʼ εὐμενέτῃσι Od. 6.185, IG 12(8).23 ( Lemnos, ii A. D.):—fem. Εὐμεν-έτειρα, Hsch.
to be gracious, Ps.-Phoc. 142, Opp. C. 1.9, etc.; τινι to one, A.R. 2.260, Theoc. 17.62.

children.label: II
children.definition: deal kindly with, ἀνεψιόν Pi. P. 4.127 (s.v.l.); but also,
Pass., of benefits graciously bestowed, IPE 12.362.12 (Cherson.).

well-disposed, kindly, τινι to one, epith. of gods, h.Hom. 22.7 (not in Il. or Od.), Pi. P. 2.25, A. Supp. 686 (lyr.), cf. X. HG 6.4.2; ἵλεως καὶ εὐ. Id. Cyr. 1.6.2, Theoc. 5.18; Ἑρμῆς IGRom. 1.1228 ( Egypt, ii A. D.); τὸ τῶν θεῶν εὐ. D. 4.45.

A. Pers. 175 (troch.), Supp. 488 ( Comp.); πόλει S. Ant. 212, etc.; εὐ. πρός τι well-disposed for it, Plu. Luc. 42; τὸ εὐ., = εὐμένεια, Pl. Lg. 792e; ξεῖνος δὲ ξείνῳ . . -έστατον πάντων Hdt. 7.237: in Dor. Prose, Schwyzer 84 ( Argos, v B. C.).
εὐμενεῖ τύχα, νόῳ, Pi. O. 14.15, P. 8.18; εὐ. ὀλολυγμός signifying goodwill, friendly, A. Th. 268.

γῆ εὐ. ἐναγωνίσασθαι favourable to fight in, Th. 2.74; εὐμενεῖ ποτῷ (of a river) kindly, bounteous, A. Pers. 487; of the air, mild, soft, Thphr. CP 2.1.6; so of medicines, beneficial, ὑποχονδρίῳ καὶ σπλάγχνοισιν Hp. Acut. 59, cf. Aret. CA 1.3; but also, agreeable, [ κόμμι]-έστερον κόλλης Hp. Art. 33; of a road, easy, X. An. 4.6.12 ( Comp.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. - νῶς, Ion. - έως, A. Ag. 952, Pl. Phd. 89a, A.R. 2.1275, etc.: Comp. - έστερον E. Hel. 1298, Pl. Lg. 718d; also - εστέρως Isoc. 4.43, D.H. Rh. 5.

the gracious goddesses, euphem. of the Ἐρινύες or Furies, name of play by A.; ὥς σφας καλοῦμεν Εὐμενίδας, ἐξ εὐμενῶν στέρνων δέχεσθαι τὸν ἱκέτην S. OC 486; ὀνομάζειν γὰρ αἰδοῦμαι θεὰς Εὐμενίδας E. Or. 38; distd. from the σεμναὶ θεαί by Philem. 217.

data.quote: ὥς σφας καλοῦμεν Εὐμενίδας, ἐξ εὐμενῶν στέρνων δέχεσθαι τὸν ἱκέτην

children.definition: propitiate, ἥρωας X. Cyr. 3.3.22, cf. Ael. NA 7.44; τινα διά τινος App. BC 4.54.
like the εὐμενής, of persons, Arist. VV 1251b32; διόρθωσις Plb. 12.7.6.
guild of worshippers of Eumenes, Ath.Mitt. 27.172.
easily divided, Thphr. CP 6.10.8.
easily calculated, Hp. Septim. 3.
changeableness, Sch. Th. 3.37.
easily changed, changeable. Arist. Rh. 1373a30, M.Ant. 5.33, etc.; of food, easy of digestion, Hp. Alim. 49; τὸ εὐ., = foreg., Aesop. 367, Iamb. Protr. 21. κςʼ. Adv. -τως Sch. Th. 3.37.

changeable, of things and persons, Gorg. Hel. 13, Pl. R. 503c, X. HG 2.3.32, Arist. EN 1100b3, etc.; εὐ. ἐστὶν . . βίος Diph. 118; ἀνὴρ εὐ. γλώσσῃ LXX Pr. 17.20; τὸ εὐ., = εὐμεταβλησία, M.Ant. 4.3; τὸ εὐ. τῆς τύχης Diogenian.Epicur. 2.60.
fickle, Vett.Val. 304.28 (nisi leg. - γνωστος).
easy to put aside, get rid of, Gal. 19.558; easily moved, Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.2.2.
readily imparting, generous, 1 Ep.Ti. 6.18, Vett.Val. 46.24, al., Herm. in Phdr. p.94 A.; τὸ εὐ. generosity, M.Ant. 1.14.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., easily imparted, μυστήρια Sch. Ar. Pl. 1014; of leprosy, contagious, Paul.Aeg. 4.1. Adv. - τως Hsch. s.v. εὐσυναλλάκτως.
easily changing, πρὸς ἔλεον Plu. Praec. 2.799c; changeable, fickle, Id. Dio 53, Vett.Val. 243.30, App. Mac. 16.

children.label: II
children.definition: portable, Gal. 11.215.
easily moved or changed, ἐπὶ τὸ χεῖρον Arist. Metaph. 1019a28; τὸ εὐ. caprice, M.Ant. 1.16.
ready to migrate, Sch. Th. 1.2.
portable, Aët. 1.39.
easy to roll over, τὸ τῆς βάσεως (sc. τῆς τύχης) εὐ. Gal. Protr. 2.
inconstant, fickle, Vett.Val. 11.17, al.
easy to persuade, Arist. EN 1151b6, Them. Or. 7.98b.
easily altered, ὑπὸ φύσιος καὶ ὑπὸ τύχης Hp. Decent. 13.
unstable, παιδία Thphr. Sens. 45; τὸ τῆς τύχης εὐ. D.S. 9.10, cf. Secund. Sent. 9. Adv. - τως v.l. in Arr. Epict. 2.22.8.
easily diverted from its course, χυμός Aët. 5.57 (- ρυστός ed.).
unsteady, changeable, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.5d.
revocable, gloss on παλινάγρετον, Sch. Il. 1.526, cf. Suid. s.v. ἀβέβαιος.
τὸ εὐ. easy convertibility, Gal. 6.825.
easily moved: moving quickly, ὀφθαλμοί EM 255.52; gloss on θοός, Sch. A.R. 1.741.
manageable, of persons, Isoc. Ep. 2.20, Pl. Phdr. 240a, X. An. 2.6.20; of things, Onos. 6.5; λόγος -ότερος Isoc. Ep. 9.2; σώματα εὐ. τῇ τέχνῃ Max.Tyr. 10.3; χρεία εὐ. πρὸς τὸ ζῆν Arist. Pol. 1257a37.
easy to cope with, ἰσχύς Th. 6.85, cf. X. HG 5.2.15; of persons, D.H. 8.6 ( Comp.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Act. signf., Adv. -τως handily, adroitly, τῇ ἀσπίδι χρῆσθαι Philostr. Gym. 19, cf. Eustr. in EN 343.32.
good measure or proportion, Aret. CA 2.3; θεία εὐ. Hierocl. in CA 23p.468M., cf. Longin. Proll.Heph. 5.
excellence of metre, Eust. 1414.9.
well-measured, well-calculated, σφενδόνα A. Ag. 1010 (lyr.); well-proportioned, v.l. for ἔμμητρον, Theoc. 25.209.
of moderate size or proportions, οἶκος Aret. CA 1.1. Adv. - ως ib. 1.6, Sor. 1.86.
excellent in metre, [ λέξις] εὔ. καὶ εὔρυθμος D.H. Comp. 25; opp. κακόμετρος, Phld. Po. 1676.8.

definition: εὐμήκης, Dor. εὐμάκης [ ᾱ], ες, ( μῆκος)

children.definition: tall, Pl. Prm. 127b, Thphr. HP 3.9.2, Theoc. 14.25; long, ξυστοί Jul. Or. 2.60a: Comp. - έστερος Arist. PA 696a17: Sup. - έστατος PPetr. 2p.14 (iii B.C.), Str. 5.2.5.
considerable, great, τύχαι E. IA 595 (anap.).
εὔμηκες, τό, kind of balsam, Plin. HN 12.114.
rich in sheep, Od. 15.406, h.Ap. 54, Pi. O. 6.100, Simon. 103, Theoc. 22.157, etc.
with beautiful thighs, Poll. 2.187, 9.162.
easy to spin out, Luc. Fug. 12.
wise, prudent, Opp. H. 5.97, AP 9.59.8 (Antip. <Thess.>), prob. in Phld. Rh. 2.14 S.
ingenious contrivance, dub. in Chrysipp. ap. EM 701.25 (cf. Stoic. 2.318).
skill in devising means, c. inf., Pi. I. 4(3).2, Pae. 7 Fr. 16.11; = εὐπορία, Stoic. 3.64, Plu. Tim. 16; inventive skill, Andronic.Rhod. p.578 M., Luc. Phal. 1.12.

children.label: I
children.definition: skilful in contriving, inventive, opp. ἀμήχανος, A. Eu. 381 (lyr.), Pl. Prt. 344d, etc.: c. gen., εὐμήχανος λόγου Id. Cra. 408b; ἁλίων εὐ. ἔργων Opp. H. 4.593: with a Prep., εὐ. πρὸς τὸν βίον, of birds, full of devices for supporting life, Arist. HA 614b34, cf. 616b34: Sup., of the bee, Gp. 15.3.1; ἔν τινι D.S. 20.92: τὸ εὐ., = foreg., Plu. Vit. aer. al. 2.830c. Adv. - νως Ph. 1.170, Plu. Per. 31, Aristaenet. 2.15, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., of things, skilfully contrived, ingenious, ἐκ τῶν ἀμηχάνων πόρους εὐμηχάνους πορίζων Ar. Eq. 759 (- ος πορίζειν Bentl.); ἐπίνοιαι Pl. R. 600a.

data.quote: ἐκ τῶν ἀμηχάνων πόρους εὐμηχάνους πορίζων

children.definition: social, Them. Or. 22.270d.
frequented, v.l. for εὐεπίμικτος, Poll. 3.96.
easily imitated, Pl. R. 605a.
happy union, Sammelb. 5656.7 (vi A.D.).
well-hated, in Sup., X. Cyr. 3.1.9, Longin. Rh. p.198 H.
with fine threads, εὐμίτοις πλοκαῖς, i.e. τὸν μίτον εὖ πλέκουσα, E. IT 817.
with beautiful μίτρα (q.v.), Mosch. 4.98.
armed with good ashen spear, ἐϋμμελίω ( Ion. gen.) Πριάμοιο Il. 4.47, al.; Πάνθου υἱὸς ἐϋμμελίης 17.9, cf. Od. 3.400, Hes. Sc. 368, etc.: Dor. gen. ἐϋμμελία APl. 16.6.
easy to remember, Pl. Ti. 18c, 18d, D. 56.45, Aen. Tact. 24.14, Ath. 7.277c, etc.: Comp. - ότερος Arist. Rh. 1367a26: Sup., ib. 1409b6.

children.label: II
children.definition: at oneʼs fingers’ ends, ἔστω σοι εὐ. φάρμακα Hp. Decent. 9.

definition: εὐμνήμων, ον, gen. ονος, in Adv. Comp. - εστέρως, ἔχειν to be

children.definition: easier to remember, X. Ages. 11.1.
well-remembering, mindful, τινος S. Tr. 108 (lyr.); χρηστήριον Boeoi.
industry, Aglaïas 4.
to be well off for, c. gen., Hp. Ep. 27, Phalar. Ep. 53 (v.l. for εὐπορεῖν), Anon. Fig. p.156 S.; εὐμοίρει, in Epitaphs, IG 14.2387, etc.
happy possession of a thing, σώματος, φωνῆς, Luc. Eun. 8, Salt. 72; εὐ. τῆς αἱρέσεως excelling, Id. Rh.Pr. 8; φύσεως εὐ. Ph. 1.238, al.: abs., D.H. Rh. 5.3; good fortune, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.14c, etc.
IG 14.555 ( Catana), 2300 ( Comum, v A.D.).

well-endowed by fortune, B. 5.1; opp. ἄμοιρος, Pl. Smp. 197d, cf. Ph. 1.282, Call. Del. 295, AP 6.278 ( Rhian.), Luc. JConf. 19. Adv. - ρως, ἀποθανεῖν J. AJ 8.12.6; βιώσασα IG 12(5).319 ( Paros): Comp. - ότερον, ἀποθνῄσκειν App. Hann. 29.
sing well, h.Merc. 478.
sweet song, Hsch.: title of poem by Musaeus, Paus. 10.5.6.
sweetly singing, AP 9.396 ( Paul.Sil.): as pr.n. in h.Cer. 154, etc.
